title:
New insights into how Long COVID affects the brain
Premium
subtitle: No Subtitle
author: Rajeev  Jayadevan
content:
New insights into how Long COVID affects the brain
Premium No Subtitle Long COVID is a condition marked by multiple persistent symptoms that sometimes occur even after mild infections. Among these, memory loss, brain fog and sleep disturbances indicate brain involvement. MRI scans done before and after COVID-19 show shrinkage in certain brain regions, pointing to tissue loss. This raises crucial questions: how does a respiratory virus go on to affect the brain? And what drives brain inflammation in these patients? Two recent papers provide insights into how the virus might indirectly affect the brain. A study published in Cell Host & Microbe concludes that continued presence of the virus spike protein could be triggering inflammation and neurodegenerative changes in the brain. The spike also activates inflammatory pathways. When researchers injected spike protein into the skulls of mice, they observed brain inflammation along with behavioural changes.

title:
Preventing malaria using genetically modified malaria parasites
Premium
subtitle: Genetically modified malaria-causing parasites do not cause disease; they instead prime the immune system during the initial stage of their life cycle in the liver
author: R. Prasad
content:
Preventing malaria using genetically modified malaria parasites
Premium Genetically modified malaria-causing parasites do not cause disease; they instead prime the immune system during the initial stage of their life cycle in the liver Two vaccines against malaria have been rolled out in some countries in Africa. Besides vaccines, scientists have been using genetically altered mosquitoes to stop the spread of malaria. One is the release of radiation-sterilised male mosquitoes to prevent eggs from hatching. Another is engineering mosquitoes that slow the growth of malaria-causing parasites in the gut thereby preventing transmission of malaria to humans. The other method is using genetically modified mosquitoes that can spread resistance to malaria-causing parasites by thriving and mating with wild mosquitoes. Now, in a radical approach, scientists have shifted their focus from genetic modification of malaria-causing mosquitoes to malaria-causing parasites. They have genetically modified malaria-causing parasites so that the parasites do not cause disease. Instead, they prime the immune system during the initial stage of their life cycle in the liver and before they enter the bloodstream. Malaria-causing parasites cause infection and symptoms begin to show only when they move into the bloodstream from the liver stage.

subtitle: While five districts in Karnataka have a high MMR ratio of above 100, overall, Karnataka has seen a significant improvement in this significant public health indicator over the past several years
author: Afshan Yasmeen
content:
Ballari maternal deaths: How is Karnataka faring in maternal mortality? 
Premium While five districts in Karnataka have a high MMR ratio of above 100, overall, Karnataka has seen a significant improvement in this significant public health indicator over the past several years Five districts in Karnataka have a high Maternal Mortality Ratio (MMR) of above 100, with Chickballapur recording the highest at 159 per lakh live births, according to Karnataka’s Civil Registration System (CRS) data from 2021 -22 to 2023-24. Ballari, which is now in the limelight for a series of five maternal deaths in a short span, has recorded an MMR of 62, which is less than the State average of 64.

title:
Winter skincare: A practical guide to healthy skin for all ages 
Premium
subtitle: A tailored approach that considers age, lifestyle and skin health is crucial to maintaining resilient skin throughout the cold season
author: Monisha Madhumita
content:
Winter skincare: A practical guide to healthy skin for all ages 
Premium A tailored approach that considers age, lifestyle and skin health is crucial to maintaining resilient skin throughout the cold season Winter presents unique challenges for the skin. As temperatures drop and humidity plummets, the air pulls moisture away from the skin, leaving it dry, flaky, and prone to irritation. For those with preexisting skin conditions like eczema, acne, or psoriasis, winter can aggravate symptoms, making proper care critical. While general advice such as applying moisturisers and avoiding hot showers is helpful, winter skincare demands a more thoughtful and tailored approach that considers age, lifestyle and skin health. The colder months affect skin health primarily through dehydration. The skin’s natural barrier, which retains moisture and protects against environmental irritants, becomes compromised. This breakdown can lead to conditions such as redness, cracks, and increased sensitivity, paving the way for infections or exacerbation of chronic issues. Understanding these mechanisms is key to building a sustainable and effective routine that ensures skin health throughout the season.

title: Mobile phone addiction leads to sleep deprivation across age groups: experts
subtitle: Specialists in various fields discuss excessive usage of mobile phones and its impact on sleep, lay stress on concept of sleep hygiene, which includes having a set pattern of activities
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Mobile phone addiction leads to sleep deprivation across age groups: experts Specialists in various fields discuss excessive usage of mobile phones and its impact on sleep, lay stress on concept of sleep hygiene, which includes having a set pattern of activities Fear of missing out on things that happen around them is making people of all age groups glue themselves to their mobile phones that deprives them of a good sleep, which should be 7-8 hours a day, said a group of experts on Saturday (December 7, 2024). At a panel discussion titled “Stress and Sleep: The twin burdens that deter us from achieving full potential”, which was organised as part of ‘Healthy India, Happy India’, a collaborative initiative of Naruvi Hospitals and The Hindu here, Maria Antony, specialist in child and adolescent mental health, said excessive usage of mobile phones is inimical to sleep. “Mobile phone usage has become the new-age aliment for many people as they think smartphones are the only way of recreation,” she explained. The hour-long discussion was moderated by Ramya Kannan, Chief of Bureau (Tamil Nadu), The Hindu.

title: Amid turmoil, Kolkata hospitals say they will not discriminate based on nationality, will continue to treat Bangladeshi patients
subtitle: The medical fraternity said it does not support the one hospital in Kolkata that had issued a statement barring Bangladeshi patients; the State’s Indian Medical Association branch has strongly said that turning away a patient based on nationality amounts to a violation of medical ethics
author: Shrabana Chatterjee
content: Amid turmoil, Kolkata hospitals say they will not discriminate based on nationality, will continue to treat Bangladeshi patients The medical fraternity said it does not support the one hospital in Kolkata that had issued a statement barring Bangladeshi patients; the State’s Indian Medical Association branch has strongly said that turning away a patient based on nationality amounts to a violation of medical ethics After incidents of atrocities against Hindu minorities in Bangladesh and of Bangladeshi students allegedly trampling on the Indian flag were reported, news reports of hospitals in West Bengal refusing to treat Bangladeshi patients spread like wildfire. The State sees and treats hundreds of Bangladeshi patients every year, primarily in its capital city Kolkata. But how true are the reports of ‘boycotts?’ And what does the medical fraternity feel about the issue? The issue began on November 29, when the J.N. Ray Hospital, in a statement said, “Lakhs of soldiers from our country shed their blood to bring freedom to Bangladesh, so when they insult our national flag, we cannot maintain cordial relations with them.” This statement made by the hospital’s director Subhrangshu Bhakta, said that they would offer no treatment or medical assistance to any Bangladeshi nationals and had a ‘no entry’ policy for Bangladeshi nationals.

subtitle: Udhayanidhi inaugurates joint initiative of The Hindu and Naruvi Hospitals, Vellore, aimed at building awareness on preventive healthcare
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Healthy India, Happy India’ campaign begins Udhayanidhi inaugurates joint initiative of The Hindu and Naruvi Hospitals, Vellore, aimed at building awareness on preventive healthcare ‘Healthy India, Happy India’, a joint initiative of The Hindu and Naruvi Hospitals, Vellore, to build awareness on preventive healthcare and promote wellness was inaugurated by Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin on Saturday. Mr. Udhayanidhi appreciated the partnership to take the message on health to people. G.V. Sampath, founder and chairman, Naruvi Hospitals, explained the genesis of the project, while N. Ram, director, The Hindu Group, highlighted Tamil Nadu’s leadership in healthcare initiatives.

title: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar
subtitle: Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

content: Parliament adjourned for the day; BJP-Congress clash over Adani, Soros issues BJP leaders accused the Congress party of colluding with billionaire George Soros Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) accused the Congress and its leadership of colluding with U.S. billionaire George Soros and anti-India forces, plunging the Lok Sabha into chaos and leading to its adjournment for the day. Speaking during Zero Hour, Mr. Rijiju also hit out at Congress leaders for attacking the dignity of Parliament by coming to the House by wearing masks and jackets with caricatures.

subtitle: Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said
author: Peerzada Ashiq
content: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said National Conference MP Aga Syed Ruhullah on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said he would move an impeachment motion in Parliament against Justice Shekhar K. Yadav, sitting judge in the Allahabad High Court, over the latter’s recent remarks against Muslims. “I am moving impeachment motion in the Parliament in accordance with Art 124(4) of the constitution for the removal of this Justice namely Shekhar K Yadav, a sitting Judge in Hon’ble High Court of Judicature at Allahabad on the charges mentioned in the notice,”,” Mr. Ruhullah said.

subtitle: Congress is a national party and has the highest number of MPs among the INDIA allies...All constituents of the alliance are willing to discuss the issue, says Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut reacting to Lalu Prasad Yadav’s comment on leader of INDIA alliance
author: Miscellaneous
content: INDIA bloc leadership is open question, indicates Shiv Sena (UBT) Congress is a national party and has the highest number of MPs among the INDIA allies...All constituents of the alliance are willing to discuss the issue, says Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut reacting to Lalu Prasad Yadav’s comment on leader of INDIA alliance Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) indicated that his party was open to discussing if someone outside the Congress should lead the Opposition's INDIA bloc. Also Read | Mamata Banerjee should be allowed to lead INDIA bloc: RJD chief Lalu Prasad

title: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others
subtitle: The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). The agency has submitted the prosecution complaint against Sikandar Singh, son of former MLA Dharam Singh Chokker, Mahira Infatech Private Limited, D S Home Construction Private Limited, and others.

title: Opposition submits notice for moving no-confidence motion against Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar
subtitle: Congress leaders Jairam Ramesh and Naseer Hussain submitted the notice to Rajya Sabha Secretary-General P.C. Mody
author: Miscellaneous
content: Opposition submits notice for moving no-confidence motion against Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar Congress leaders Jairam Ramesh and Naseer Hussain submitted the notice to Rajya Sabha Secretary-General P.C. Mody Opposition parties on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) submitted a notice to move a motion for removing Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar for allegedly conducting the House in a partisan manner. Parliament proceedings highlights — December 10, 2024

title: Opposition protests Adani issue in Parliament premises with black bags
subtitle: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, MPs from the Congress, DMK, JMM, Left, among others, protested with bag blacks with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and ‘Modi Adani Bhai Bhai’ written on the obverse side
author: Miscellaneous
content: Opposition protests Adani issue in Parliament premises with black bags Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, MPs from the Congress, DMK, JMM, Left, among others, protested with bag blacks with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and ‘Modi Adani Bhai Bhai’ written on the obverse side Several opposition MPs on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) demonstrated over the Adani issue in Parliament premises, carrying black 'jholas' (bags) with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and 'Modi Adani Bhai Bhai' written on the obverse side. This is the latest in the series of  protests led by the Congress daily ahead of the sitting of Parliament in the morning.

title: Justice Yadav’s speech at VHP event: Supreme Court takes note, seeks details from Allahabad HC
subtitle: Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav attended an event organised by VHP and spoke on the subject of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Justice Yadav’s speech at VHP event: Supreme Court takes note, seeks details from Allahabad HC Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav attended an event organised by VHP and spoke on the subject of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) The Supreme Court on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) took note of the reports related to a sitting Allahabad High Court Judge Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav’s speech at a Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) event and sought details from the Allahabad High Court. Also Read | All India Lawyers Union demands action against Allahabad HC judge for speech at VHP event

title: Mamata Banerjee should be allowed to lead INDIA bloc: RJD chief Lalu Prasad
subtitle: Lalu Prasad’s comment comes days after Mamata Banerjee expressed her intent to take charge of the anti-BJP coalition
author: Miscellaneous
content: Mamata Banerjee should be allowed to lead INDIA bloc: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Lalu Prasad’s comment comes days after Mamata Banerjee expressed her intent to take charge of the anti-BJP coalition Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Prasad on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) asserted that West Bengal Chief Minister and Trinamool Congress supremo Mamata Banerjee should be allowed to lead the INDIA bloc. His comment comes days after Ms. Banerjee expressed her intent to take charge of the anti-BJP coalition.

title: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister
subtitle: Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy S.M. Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure. Political, business leaders condole the death of former Karnataka CM S.M. Krishna | LIVE

title: SC uses plenary powers to allow a woman Army officer’s plea for permanent commission
subtitle: A Bench of Justices B.R. Gavai and K.V. Viswanathan, while illustrating, observed that thoughts on conditions of service and job perquisites would be last in the minds of valiant Indian soldiers bravely guarding the frontiers
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: SC uses plenary powers to allow a woman Army officer’s plea for permanent commission A Bench of Justices B.R. Gavai and K.V. Viswanathan, while illustrating, observed that thoughts on conditions of service and job perquisites would be last in the minds of valiant Indian soldiers bravely guarding the frontiers The Supreme Court on Monday (December 9, 2024) exercised its extraordinary powers under Article 142 of the Constitution to grant permanent commission to a woman Army officer with a distinguished service record who was wrongly excluded from the consideration when other similarly placed officers were given the benefit. A Bench of Justices B.R. Gavai and K.V. Viswanathan, while illustrating, observed that thoughts on conditions of service and job perquisites would be last in the minds of valiant Indian soldiers bravely guarding the frontiers at Siachen or in other difficult terrains.

title: Mamata warns Bangladeshi politicians; hopes Foreign Secretary’s visit will provide positive outcome
subtitle: The West Bengal CM, who had earlier sought peacekeeping forces from the United Nations to intervene in  Bangladesh, also condemned the attacks on Hindus in the neighbouring country
author: Shiv Sahay Singh
content: Mamata warns Bangladeshi politicians; hopes Foreign Secretary’s visit will provide positive outcome The West Bengal CM, who had earlier sought peacekeeping forces from the United Nations to intervene in  Bangladesh, also condemned the attacks on Hindus in the neighbouring country Taking a dig at a section of Bangladeshi politicians, who have said the neighbouring country has legitimate claims over the Indian States of West Bengal, Bihar and Odisha, Chief Minister of West Bengal Mamata Banerjee on Monday (December 9, 2024) asked if Indians “would have lollipop” when external forces tried to occupy Indian lands. “Some people are saying we will occupy Bengal, Bihar, Odisha. I tell them — be happy and healthy. Not just you, no one has that audacity to occupy all these States. You will take all this and we will sit and eat lollipops? We are ready to have our patience tested, if need be,” Ms. Banerjee said in the State Assembly.

title: Reservation must not be based on religion, Supreme Court tells West Bengal
subtitle: West Bengal has filed an appeal against a Calcutta HC judgment striking down its policy to include several castes, largely Muslim communities, in the State’s OBC list
author: Krishnadas Rajagopal
content: Reservation must not be based on religion, Supreme Court tells West Bengal West Bengal has filed an appeal against a Calcutta HC judgment striking down its policy to include several castes, largely Muslim communities, in the State’s OBC list The Supreme Court on Monday (December 9, 2024) orally observed that reservation must not be based on religion while hearing an appeal filed by the State of West Bengal against a Calcutta High Court judgment striking down its policy to include several castes, largely Muslim communities, in the State’s Other Backward Classes (OBC) list. The Calcutta High Court had concluded that religion was the “sole criterion for declaring these communities as OBC”. It had found the “selection of 77 classes of Muslims as backwards an affront to the Muslim community as a whole”.

title: All India Lawyers Union demands action against Allahabad HC judge for speech at VHP event
subtitle: AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi terms speech of Justice Yadav as ‘unfortunate’
author: Ishita Mishra
content: All India Lawyers Union demands action against Allahabad HC judge for speech at VHP event AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi terms speech of Justice Yadav as ‘unfortunate’ The All India Lawyers Union on Monday (December 9, 2024) wrote a letter to the President and Chief Justice of India seeking action against Allahabad High Court judge, Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav, for his speech at a Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) event. The lawyers’ union said the speech “amounted to hate speech against the Muslim minority”. Also Read | Justice Yadav’s speech at VHP event: Supreme Court takes note, seeks details from Allahabad HC

title: One lakh talented youth will be urged to join politics: PM Modi
subtitle: In a virtual address, Mr. Modi said spiritual leader Swami Vivekananda was of the opinion that participation of youth will be crucial for the nation’s development
author: Miscellaneous
content: One lakh talented youth will be urged to join politics: PM Modi In a virtual address, Mr. Modi said spiritual leader Swami Vivekananda was of the opinion that participation of youth will be crucial for the nation’s development Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday (December 9, 2024) said efforts are being made to bring youth into politics because it cannot be left to those who only believe in dynastic politics and consider it as family property. Virtually addressing an event organised by Ramakrishna Math at Lekhamba village near Sanand town in Gujarat, the Prime Minister said the Young Leaders’ Dialogue will be organised in Delhi on the birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda to “make a new beginning” towards this aim.

title: Stealth frigate INS Tushil commissioned into Indian Navy in Russia
subtitle: India, along with its friendly countries, believes in ensuring that maritime trade in the region remains safe and secure: Rajnath
author: Dinakar Peri
content: Stealth frigate INS Tushil commissioned into Indian Navy in Russia India, along with its friendly countries, believes in ensuring that maritime trade in the region remains safe and secure: Rajnath India and Russia will enter a new era of cooperation by taking advantage of each other’s expertise in areas such as Artificial Intelligence, cyber security, space exploration and counter-terrorism, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Monday (December 9, 2024) as stealth guided missile frigate INS Tushil was commissioned into the Indian Navy at Kaliningrad, Russia. Mr. Singh termed Russia’s support to India’s vision of ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ as another important example of deep friendship between the two countries. “Made in India content is continuously increasing in many ships including INS Tushil. The ship is a big proof of the collaborative prowess of Russian and Indian industries. It exemplifies India’s journey towards technological excellence through jointmanship,” he said at the commissioning ceremony.

title: BJP is spreading ‘fake news’, says French media house Mediapart
subtitle: Mediapart said that it “firmly condemns the instrumentalisation of its recently published investigative article about OCCRP by the Bharatiya Janata Party... in order to serve BJP’s political agenda and attack press freedom”
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: BJP is spreading ‘fake news’, says French media house Mediapart Mediapart said that it “firmly condemns the instrumentalisation of its recently published investigative article about OCCRP by the Bharatiya Janata Party... in order to serve BJP’s political agenda and attack press freedom” Days after the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) accused the US State Department of fomenting disaffection against the Government of India, the French news outlet Mediapart, which the BJP had cited while making the allegations, has said that the BJP was spreading ‘fake news’ using its reports. U.S. State Department should clarify allegations over OCCRP, says BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi

title: Government may introduce Bill on simultaneous polls, refer it to joint committee for consultation
subtitle: The government wants to consult the Speakers of various State Assemblies through parliamentary committees; In September, it had indicated that it plans to bring three Bills, including two to amend the Constitution
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Government may introduce Bill on simultaneous polls, refer it to joint committee for consultation The government wants to consult the Speakers of various State Assemblies through parliamentary committees; In September, it had indicated that it plans to bring three Bills, including two to amend the Constitution Keen to hold wider consultations on the proposed Bills to implement simultaneous elections to the Lok Sabha, State Assemblies and local bodies, the Union government may bring these Bills as early as the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament, a government source said on Monday (December 9, 2024). The source said once the Bill, or a set of Bills, is introduced in Parliament, it is likely to be referred to a joint committee of the Lok Sabha and the Rajya Sabha for extensive consultations. The government is keen to consult all the Speakers of various State Assemblies through parliamentary committees.

title: SC moots agency to enhance Delhi green cover
subtitle: Bench says, “We permit the amicus to suggest names of the agencies which will be able to take up this task”
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: SC moots agency to enhance Delhi green cover Bench says, “We permit the amicus to suggest names of the agencies which will be able to take up this task” The Supreme Court on Monday (December 9, 2024) suggested the constitution of a specialised agency dedicated to enhancing the national capital’s depleting green cover. A Bench of Justices A.S. Oka and Augustine George Masih asked amicus curiae, senior advocate A.D.N. Rao, to suggest names by December 18, the next date of hearing.

title: Opposition to move notice to remove Vice-President Dhankhar
subtitle: The notice will be submitted under Article 67(b) and sources indicated that more than 50 MPs, including members from Congress, Trinamool Congress, DMK, Samajwadi Party and Left parties, have agreed to sign on the notice
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Opposition to move notice to remove Vice-President Dhankhar The notice will be submitted under Article 67(b) and sources indicated that more than 50 MPs, including members from Congress, Trinamool Congress, DMK, Samajwadi Party and Left parties, have agreed to sign on the notice Opposition parties in the INDIA bloc have decided to move a notice to remove Chairman of the Rajya Sabha Jagdeep Dhankhar from his office. The notice will be submitted under Article 67(b) of the Constitution and sources indicated that more than 50 MPs, including members from the Congress, Trinamool Congress, DMK, Samajwadi Party and the Left parties, have agreed to sign the notice.

title: Youth Congress launches campaign against unemployment, drug abuse
subtitle: IYC president Uday Bhanu Chib said the BJP had promised two crore jobs every year, but ever since the Modi government came to power, only 0.3% of candidates who applied got government jobs
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Youth Congress launches campaign against unemployment, drug abuse IYC president Uday Bhanu Chib said the BJP had promised two crore jobs every year, but ever since the Modi government came to power, only 0.3% of candidates who applied got government jobs The Indian Youth Congress (IYC) on Monday (December 9, 2024) launched the new edition of its ‘Young India Ke Bol’ campaign, focusing on unemployment and drug abuse. IYC president Uday Bhanu Chib and All India Congress Committee in-charge of National Students’ Union of India Kanhaiya Kumar addressed a press conference at the party headquarters after the poster launch.

title: India questions Musk's Starlink for more clues in $4.2-billion drug smuggling case
subtitle: The incident has set off alarm bells as it is the first time Starlink's device has been used to navigate and reach Indian waters in a major drug haul.
author: Miscellaneous
content: India questions Musk's Starlink for more clues in $4.2-billion drug smuggling case The incident has set off alarm bells as it is the first time Starlink's device has been used to navigate and reach Indian waters in a major drug haul. Police have sent a legal demand to Elon Musk’s Starlink seeking details of who purchased its internet device that helped in sea navigation of smugglers who were caught with $4.2 billion worth of meth in the biggest such Indian seizure. Two people with direct knowledge of the police notice sent by Andaman and Nicobar island officials said Starlink had been asked for the purchaser’s name and payment method, registration details and where the internet device was used when smugglers travelled in international waters from Myanmar to India.

title: After Assad’s ouster, India calls for peaceful, inclusive political process in Syria
subtitle: New Delhi says all parties in the country must ‘work towards preserving the unity, sovereignty and territorial integrity of Syria’; experts say India must pay close attention to events both inside Syria and its borders with Israel, Turkiye, and Iraq
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: After Assad’s ouster, India calls for peaceful, inclusive political process in Syria New Delhi says all parties in the country must ‘work towards preserving the unity, sovereignty and territorial integrity of Syria’; experts say India must pay close attention to events both inside Syria and its borders with Israel, Turkiye, and Iraq India on Monday (December 9, 2024) called for a peaceful and inclusive political process in Syria to find a resolution to the dramatic turn of events after President Bashar al-Assad fled to Russia and rebel forces claimed control of the capital, Damascus. The events took New Delhi by surprise, given that the Ministry of External Affairs had hosted Foreign Office Consultations with Syrian officials less than a fortnight ago.

title: NRAI warns restaurants about aggregator payment gateways, deep discounting
subtitle: The advisory comes when food delivery giants including Zomato and Swiggy are aggressively focusing on expanding their dine-in customer base
author: Miscellaneous
content: NRAI warns restaurants about aggregator payment gateways, deep discounting The advisory comes when food delivery giants including Zomato and Swiggy are aggressively focusing on expanding their dine-in customer base The National Restaurant Association of India has issued an advisory cautioning its members over deep discounting and payment gateway tools offered by aggregator platforms for dine-in operations. The advisory comes when food delivery giants including Zomato and Swiggy are aggressively focusing on expanding their dine-in customer base.

title: Sheena Bora murder case: Supreme Court notice to CBI on Indrani Mukerjea’s plea to travel abroad
subtitle: A Bench headed by Justice M.M. Sundresh issued notice to the special leave petition filed by Indrani Mukerjea, represented by advocates Sana Raees Khan and Sandeep Singh
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Sheena Bora murder case: Supreme Court notice to CBI on Indrani Mukerjea’s plea to travel abroad A Bench headed by Justice M.M. Sundresh issued notice to the special leave petition filed by Indrani Mukerjea, represented by advocates Sana Raees Khan and Sandeep Singh The Supreme Court of India on Monday (December 9, 2024) sought a response from the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to a plea by former media executive Indrani Mukerjea, accused of killing her daughter Sheena Bora, challenging a Bombay High Court decision refusing her permission to travel out of the country. A Bench headed by Justice M.M. Sundresh issued notice to the special leave petition filed by Mukerjea, represented by advocates Sana Raees Khan and Sandeep Singh.

title: 25 lakh now enrolled for Ayushman Vay Vandana Cards
subtitle: Treatment worth over ₹40 crore has been availed, benefitting more than 22,000 senior citizens aged  70 years and above, since the AVVC was launched in October
author: Bindu Shajan Perappadan
content: 25 lakh now enrolled for Ayushman Vay Vandana Cards Treatment worth over ₹40 crore has been availed, benefitting more than 22,000 senior citizens aged  70 years and above, since the AVVC was launched in October Enrolment for the Ayushman Vay Vandana Card (AVVC), launched on October 29, has reached 25 lakh. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had announced the expansion of the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB PM-JAY) to include all senior citizens aged 70 years and above. Since the card’s launch, treatments worth more than ₹40 crore have been availed by 22,000 senior citizens above the age of 70 years, a release issued by the Health Ministry said on Monday (December 9, 2024).

title: National Food Security Act still driven by figures from 2011 census, Supreme Court told
subtitle: Calculation of food grains distributed to States by the Centre under the NFSA relied on a census that was carried out over 13 years ago, advocate Prashant Bhushan said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: National Food Security Act still driven by figures from 2011 census, Supreme Court told Calculation of food grains distributed to States by the Centre under the NFSA relied on a census that was carried out over 13 years ago, advocate Prashant Bhushan said The Supreme Court on Monday (December 9, 2024) orally remarked that a long-term response to problems of food security was to generate employment, even as advocate Prashant Bhushan said the National Food Security Act (NFSA) continued to be driven by figures from the 2011 census. Mr. Bhushan argued that the calculation of food grains distributed to States by the Centre under the NFSA banked on a census carried out over 13 years ago. Meanwhile, the pandemic had happened. The government’s top law officers responded that the Centre was committed to food security. They urged the court to not give ear to “armchair intellectuals”.

title: Supreme Court should put a stop to lawsuits seeking survey of mosques: CPI(M)
subtitle: After a two-day meeting of the CPI(M) Politburo on December 7-8, the Left party said it is unfortunate that the Supreme Court has not intervened to put a stop to such litigations
author: Miscellaneous
content: Supreme Court should put a stop to lawsuits seeking survey of mosques: CPI(M) After a two-day meeting of the CPI(M) Politburo on December 7-8, the Left party said it is unfortunate that the Supreme Court has not intervened to put a stop to such litigations The CPI(M) Politburo on Monday (December 9, 2024) voiced concern over the spate of lawsuits filed across the country seeking survey of ancient mosques to verify the presence of temple ruins lying underneath. "After Varanasi and Mathura, in Sambhal, a survey was ordered of a 16th century mosque by a lower court. This resulted in violence in which four Muslim youth were killed. Following this, a similar petition has been entertained in the civil court in Ajmer regarding the Ajmer Sharif Dargah," the party said.

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea to clear road blockade caused by farmers' protest
subtitle: The plea has alleged that farmers' and their unions have blocked the entire national and State highways in Punjab for an indefinite period
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Supreme Court dismisses plea to clear road blockade caused by farmers' protest The plea has alleged that farmers' and their unions have blocked the entire national and State highways in Punjab for an indefinite period The Supreme Court on Monday (December 9, 2024) refused to entertain a plea directing the Centre and authorities to immediately clear blockades on national and State highways in Punjab where farmers are staging protests. A Bench headed by Justice Surya Kant said similar petitions are already pending in the apex court, and it did not want another one to add to the number.

title: U.S. State Department should clarify allegations over OCCRP, says BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi
subtitle: “The U.S. State Department should clarify whether or not they are involved in such activities and if they are not, then they should withdraw their support from such OCCRP organisations,” Rajya Sabha MP Sudhanshu Trivedi said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: U.S. State Department should clarify allegations over OCCRP, says BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi “The U.S. State Department should clarify whether or not they are involved in such activities and if they are not, then they should withdraw their support from such OCCRP organisations,” Rajya Sabha MP Sudhanshu Trivedi said The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Monday (December 9, 2024) said the allegations made by the party on the U.S. State Department with regard to the Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP) was based on the media report by French publication Mediapart and that it was up to the U.S. State Department to clarify. “In this context, during our presser on this issue, we had quoted a media report by a French publication, published in Sarajevo in which it was made clear that the OCCRP project was funded partially by the U.S. State Department and by George Soros. It is therefore incumbent on them [U.S. State Department] to clarify whether what has been said in the report is correct or not,” said Rajya Sabha MP Sudhanshu Trivedi.

title: Implementation of POSH Act to political parties: ‘Approach Election Commission first,’ Supreme Court tells petitioner
subtitle: Justice Kant referred to a Kerala High Court decision which had found that political parties were under no obligation to comply with the POSH Act as employer-employee relationship did not exist in them
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Implementation of POSH Act to political parties: ‘Approach Election Commission first,’ Supreme Court tells petitioner Justice Kant referred to a Kerala High Court decision which had found that political parties were under no obligation to comply with the POSH Act as employer-employee relationship did not exist in them The Supreme Court of India on Monday (December 9, 2024) asked a petitioner seeking the application of the law against sexual harassment of women at workplace in political parties to first approach the Election Commission of India. A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Manmohan was hearing a petition filed by a Supreme Court lawyer, Yogamaya MG, represented by senior advocate Shobha Gupta and advocate Sriram Parakkat, for a judicial declaration that political parties were bound to comply with the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act of 2013 or the POSH Act, including the constitution of an Internal Complaints Committee.

title: Lok Sabha adjourned in a blink; scene no different in Rajya Sabha
subtitle: ‘Consensus’ reached a week ago to let Parliament function remains a non-starter; both Houses witness tumult over BJP allegation linking the Congress and the U.S. billionaire George Soros
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Lok Sabha adjourned in a blink; scene no different in Rajya Sabha ‘Consensus’ reached a week ago to let Parliament function remains a non-starter; both Houses witness tumult over BJP allegation linking the Congress and the U.S. billionaire George Soros Both Houses of Parliament failed to function on Monday (December 9, 2024) over the alleged links between U.S.-based businessman George Soros and the Congress party, and issues related to the Adani Group. Exactly a week ago, on December 2, the ruling and Opposition sides had reached an agreement to let Parliament function, reaching a consensus on holding a discussion on the Constitution in both the Houses.

title: NMC issues guidelines to spot 'fake' patients during inspections of medical facilities
subtitle: According to the guidelines, admission of large numbers of patients on the day of inspection or the previous day, admission of multiple patients from the same family or the admitted patients having no or minor problems which can be treated on OPD basis with oral medications, could be a parameter for identifying "fake patients"
author: Miscellaneous
content: NMC issues guidelines to spot 'fake' patients during inspections of medical facilities According to the guidelines, admission of large numbers of patients on the day of inspection or the previous day, admission of multiple patients from the same family or the admitted patients having no or minor problems which can be treated on OPD basis with oral medications, could be a parameter for identifying "fake patients" The National Medical Commission (NMC) has issued guidelines for identifying "fake patients" in medical colleges and facilities seeking approval for setting up new institutes or for increasing the number of UG and PG seats. This is the first time that the Commission has developed such guidelines. The guidelines come after instances of some medical institutions or colleges admitting fake patients (people who do not require any treatment or in-patient treatment) to fulfil the requirements of bed occupancy and investigation.

title: Foreign Secretary Misri conveys India’s ‘concerns’ about security of minority communities in Bangladesh
subtitle: In talks with counterpart, Foreign Secretary raises ‘some regrettable incidents of attacks on cultural, religious and diplomatic properties’
author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
content: Foreign Secretary Misri conveys India’s ‘concerns’ about security of minority communities in Bangladesh In talks with counterpart, Foreign Secretary raises ‘some regrettable incidents of attacks on cultural, religious and diplomatic properties’ Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Monday (December 9, 2024) conveyed India’s “concerns” over the safety and security of minorities in Bangladesh and urged the interim government there to follow a “constructive approach”. Mr. Misri made the remarks while holding a Foreign Office Consultation with his Bangladeshi counterpart, Mohammad Jashim Uddin, in Dhaka. He also called on Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus, who urged India to “join his initiative to revive the SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation)”.

title: 'Attack-dog' behaviour embarrassment to India: Tharoor slams BJP after U.S. rejects allegations
subtitle: In a post in X, Mr. Tharoor said, “It’s clear the BJP neither understands democracy nor diplomacy.”
author: Miscellaneous
content: 'Attack-dog' behaviour embarrassment to India: Tharoor slams BJP after U.S. rejects allegations In a post in X, Mr. Tharoor said, “It’s clear the BJP neither understands democracy nor diplomacy.” Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday (December 8, 2024) slammed the BJP after the U.S. rejected the ruling party's allegations that elements in the American "deep state" were behind attempts to destabilise India and said this "attack-dog" behaviour is an embarrassment to India. The U.S. on Saturday rejected the BJP's allegations that organisations funded by the U.S. State Department and elements in the American "deep state" were behind attempts to destabilise India through targeted attacks on Prime Minister Narendra Modi and business tycoon Gautam Adani.

title: Pune BPO employee rape-murder case: Supreme Court upholds Bombay HC order commuting convicts’ death penalty to life
subtitle: A Bench of Justices Abhay S. Oka, Ahsanuddin Amanullah and Augustine George Masih dismissed the appeal filed by the Maharashtra Government challenging the Bombay High Court judgment
author: Miscellaneous
content: Pune BPO employee rape-murder case: Supreme Court upholds Bombay HC order commuting convicts’ death penalty to life A Bench of Justices Abhay S. Oka, Ahsanuddin Amanullah and Augustine George Masih dismissed the appeal filed by the Maharashtra Government challenging the Bombay High Court judgment The Supreme Court of India on Monday (December 9, 2024) upheld an order of the Bombay High Court which commuted the death penalty of two convicts in the 2007 Pune BPO employee gang-rape and murder case to “life term for a period of 35 years” on the grounds of an inordinate delay in executing them. A Bench of Justices Abhay S. Oka, Ahsanuddin Amanullah and Augustine George Masih dismissed the appeal filed by the Maharashtra Government challenging the Bombay High Court judgment.

title: Rajnath Singh arrives in Moscow, to hold talks with Putin
subtitle: Rajnath Singh is set to hold discussions with Russian President Vladimir Putin and co-chair the India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission on Military-Technical Cooperation alongside Russian Defence Minister Andrei Belousov
author: Miscellaneous
content: Rajnath Singh arrives in Moscow, to hold talks with Putin Rajnath Singh is set to hold discussions with Russian President Vladimir Putin and co-chair the India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission on Military-Technical Cooperation alongside Russian Defence Minister Andrei Belousov Defence Minister Rajnath Singh arrived in Moscow on an official visit during which he will witness the commissioning of a stealth warship into the Indian Navy and attend the 21st meeting of India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission on Military & Military Technical Cooperation. Mr. Singh received a warm welcome on late Sunday (December 8, 2024) night by Indian Ambassador to Russia, Vinay Kumar, and Russian Deputy Minister of Defence, Alexander Fomin.

title: India will run as per wishes of its majority: Allahabad High Court judge at VHP event
subtitle: Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav makes several veiled attacks on the Muslim community while speaking about the Uniform Civil Code
author: Ishita Mishra
content: India will run as per wishes of its majority: Allahabad High Court judge at VHP event Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav makes several veiled attacks on the Muslim community while speaking about the Uniform Civil Code Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav of Allahabad High Court on Sunday (December 8, 2024) said that Hindus did not expect Muslims to follow their culture but only wanted them not to disrespect the same. Speaking on the subject of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) at an event organised by Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP), Justice Yadav added that there was no excuse to have multiple wives, triple talaq or Halala and that these practices would not work any more.

title: Indians in Syria are safe, embassy in touch with them
subtitle: “Our embassy continues to remain operational in Damascus, Syria. The embassy is in touch with all Indian nationals, and they are safe. The embassy remains available to assist Indian nationals in Syria,” said a source in the Ministry of External Affairs
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Indians in Syria are safe, embassy in touch with them “Our embassy continues to remain operational in Damascus, Syria. The embassy is in touch with all Indian nationals, and they are safe. The embassy remains available to assist Indian nationals in Syria,” said a source in the Ministry of External Affairs Officials of the Indian embassy in the Syrian capital Damascus are safe and are in contact with Indians in the conflict-hit country where the government of Bashar Al-Assad fell to a militant uprising on Sunday (December 8, 2024). “Our embassy continues to remain operational in Damascus, Syria. The embassy is in touch with all Indian nationals, and they are safe. The embassy remains available to assist Indian nationals in Syria,” said a source in the Ministry of External Affairs.

title: Foreign Secretary Misri holds talks with Bangladeshi counterpart
subtitle: No Subtitle
author: Miscellaneous
content: Foreign Secretary Misri holds talks with Bangladeshi counterpart No Subtitle Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri arrived on Monday (December 9, 2024) held talks with his Bangladeshi counterpart Mohammad Jashim Uddin, amid strained bilateral ties since August following the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Mr. Misri arrived in Dhaka earlier in the day on an Indian Air Force jet for a day-long visit, officials said. It is the first high-level visit from New Delhi after a massive uprising ended Hasina’s 15-year rule in August.

title: Foreign Secretary to meet Yunus; security, minorities and Hasina expected to dominate talks
subtitle: Talks are routine, say officials; but this is the first such high level visit by an Indian official to Dhaka for talks since the ouster of PM Sheikh Hasina in August.
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: Foreign Secretary to meet Yunus; security, minorities and Hasina expected to dominate talks Talks are routine, say officials; but this is the first such high level visit by an Indian official to Dhaka for talks since the ouster of PM Sheikh Hasina in August. Amidst growing India-Bangladesh tensions over a number of issues, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri will meet Bangladesh Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus on Monday (December 9, 2024), in the first such visit by a senior Indian official to Dhaka since the new regime took over in August after former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina fled to India. Mr. Misri will travel to Bangladesh for Foreign Office Consultations (FOC) and is expected to call on Mr. Yunus as well as Foreign Adviser Touhid Hussain, who had met External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar in New York on the sidelines of a United Nations General Assembly session in September. During the day long visit, Mr. Misri will hold talks with his counterpart Foreign Secretary Muhammad Jashim Uddin on bilateral issues, trade and other areas of cooperation, discuss contentious issues such as attacks on minorities and the jailing of a Hindu monk, the security of diplomatic missions after the attack on the Bangladesh Assistant High Commission in Agartala, as well as the future of Indian projects in Bangladesh.

title: Ayodhya verdict likely to be in frontlines of the battle for Places of Worship Act in SC
subtitle: Observations made in the judgment impress, in less than 10 pages, the necessity to keep alive a Central law so ‘intrinsically related to the obligations of a secular state’
author: Krishnadas Rajagopal
content: Ayodhya verdict likely to be in frontlines of the battle for Places of Worship Act in SC Observations made in the judgment impress, in less than 10 pages, the necessity to keep alive a Central law so ‘intrinsically related to the obligations of a secular state’ The Supreme Court’s Ram Janmabhoomi case judgment in 2019, which gave the title of the disputed Babri Masjid site to the Hindu side, finds itself in the vanguard of a legal battle on the validity of the Places of Worship Act. Observations made in the judgment impresses, in less than 10 pages, the necessity to keep alive a Central law so “intrinsically related to the obligations of a secular state”.

title: Chandigarh leads in enforcing new criminal laws
subtitle: The U.T. administration has ramped up Internet speed at police stations, provided new tablets to investigators, and set up video conferencing facilities for speedy trials; DigiLocker, the Centre’s cloud-based service to store files, and Chitra Khoji, a facial recognition software, are also being used by the police
author: Vijaita Singh
content: Chandigarh leads in enforcing new criminal laws The U.T. administration has ramped up Internet speed at police stations, provided new tablets to investigators, and set up video conferencing facilities for speedy trials; DigiLocker, the Centre’s cloud-based service to store files, and Chitra Khoji, a facial recognition software, are also being used by the police Five months after three criminal laws came into effect in the country, Chandigarh has become the first among all States and Union Territories to implement the laws in their entirety. To link key pillars of the criminal justice system — the police, forensics and judiciary — the Chandigarh administration has ramped up Internet speed at police stations, provided new tablets to investigators, and set up video conferencing facilities for speedy trials. The police are also using ‘Chitra Khoji’, a facial recognition software developed by the government, to match photos of suspects with a database of photos of 1 crore prisoners.

title: Iran, Israel relationship or absence of it source of concern, says External Affairs Minister Jaishankar
subtitle: There have been mounting global concerns over escalating tensions between Iran and Israel in the last few months.
author: Miscellaneous
content: Iran, Israel relationship or absence of it source of concern, says External Affairs Minister Jaishankar There have been mounting global concerns over escalating tensions between Iran and Israel in the last few months. The relationship or absence of it between Israel and Iran has been a source of concern and some of India's diplomatic efforts are focused on that aspect, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Sunday (December 8, 2024). In an address at the Manama Dialogue in Bahrain, Mr. Jaishankar, without directly referring to attacks on commercial ships in the Red Sea by Houthi militants, said India has an interest in trying to mitigate the security situation.

title: Parliament Winter Session highlights: Both houses adjourn for the day following Opposition protests
subtitle: The Lok Sabha is scheduled to continue to discuss The Railways (Amendment) Bill, 2024, and in the Rajya Sabha, Nirmala Sitharaman will move The Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Parliament Winter Session highlights: Both houses adjourn for the day following Opposition protests The Lok Sabha is scheduled to continue to discuss The Railways (Amendment) Bill, 2024, and in the Rajya Sabha, Nirmala Sitharaman will move The Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2024

title:
Trump’s victory gives greater momentum to the return of nationalism as a respected political issue in the West: Ram Madhav
Premium
subtitle: Trump’s presidency is likely to shake up the world at a time when the old liberal international order has reached the end of its tether with a new one is yet to fully take shape, former BJP national general secretary says
author: Nistula Hebbar
content:
Trump’s victory gives greater momentum to the return of nationalism as a respected political issue in the West: Ram Madhav
Premium Trump’s presidency is likely to shake up the world at a time when the old liberal international order has reached the end of its tether with a new one is yet to fully take shape, former BJP national general secretary says Senior leader and former national general secretary of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), and president of the conservative think tank India Foundation, Ram Madhav, speaks to The Hindu’s Nistula Hebbar on the recent U.S. election results, and the largely post-WWII ‘liberal project’, which promotes a political and economic system that places importance on individual freedom, democratic government, and open markets. What does the victory for Donald Trump in the U.S. mean for the world order and the ‘liberal project’?

title: VHP, Bajrang Dal continue protests ahead of Diljit Dosanjh concert in Indore; BJP MLAs extend support
subtitle: Indore head of the VHP’s social harmony wing says senior functionaries of the VHP and Bajrang Dal had been deployed at the concert venue to keep vigil
author: Mehul Malpani
content: VHP, Bajrang Dal continue protests ahead of Diljit Dosanjh concert in Indore; BJP MLAs extend support Indore head of the VHP’s social harmony wing says senior functionaries of the VHP and Bajrang Dal had been deployed at the concert venue to keep vigil The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) continued their protests against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore, with some Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislators voicing their support for the demands. Hundreds of people affiliated to the Hindu outfits, carrying sticks and banners, staged a protest at the Collectorate on Sunday morning.

title: Think tank employees not eligible for canteen facility: RTI reply
subtitle: Manohar Parrikar Institute for Defence and Security Analyses Director-General was issued a card ‘erroneously’, says Ministry of Defence; however, questions to the Army with respect to the process of issuing canteen smart cards did not elicit a response
author: Dinakar Peri
content: Think tank employees not eligible for canteen facility: RTI reply Manohar Parrikar Institute for Defence and Security Analyses Director-General was issued a card ‘erroneously’, says Ministry of Defence; however, questions to the Army with respect to the process of issuing canteen smart cards did not elicit a response Employees of the Manohar Parrikar Institute for Defence and Security Analyses (MP-IDSA), the autonomous think tank under the Ministry of Defence (MoD), are not authorised to receive Canteen Smart Card (CSD) facility, the MoD categorically said in an RTI response, while stating that the current Director-General (D-G) Sujan R. Chinoy was issued a card “erroneously”. “Sujan Chinoy is not eligible for canteen facility. The CSD card has been made erroneously,” the Right to Information reply dated October 22, signed by Brig. Tamojeet Biswas, Central Public Information Officer in the integrated headquarters of the MoD (Army) and addressed to The Polity, Vud Media India Foundation from Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala said.

title: CII urges Centre to stick to fiscal deficit target to avoid growth risks
subtitle: The industry body cautions that ‘overly aggressive fiscal deficit targets’ beyond 4.9% of GDP for 2024-25 and 4.5% for 2025-26 could adversely affect India’s economic growth
author: Miscellaneous
content: CII urges Centre to stick to fiscal deficit target to avoid growth risks The industry body cautions that ‘overly aggressive fiscal deficit targets’ beyond 4.9% of GDP for 2024-25 and 4.5% for 2025-26 could adversely affect India’s economic growth Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has suggested that the government stick to the fiscal deficit target of 4.9% of GDP for 2024-25 and 4.5% for 2025-26, cautioning that "overly aggressive targets" beyond these could adversely affect India's economic growth. “India has been growing rapidly amidst a slowing global economy. Prudent fiscal management for macroeconomic stability has been pivotal to this growth,” said Chandrajit Banerjee, Director General, CII, elaborating on suggestions for the forthcoming Union Budget.

title: India to become $30 trillion-economy by 2047: Dharmendra Pradhan
subtitle: Dharmendra Pradhan was delivering a lecture at the concluding function of XLRI-School of Management's year-long platinum jubilee celebration in Jharkhand’s Jamshedpur
author: Miscellaneous
content: India to become $30 trillion-economy by 2047: Dharmendra Pradhan Dharmendra Pradhan was delivering a lecture at the concluding function of XLRI-School of Management's year-long platinum jubilee celebration in Jharkhand’s Jamshedpur Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has asserted that India will become a $30 trillion-economy by 2047. Delivering a lecture at the concluding function of XLRI-School of Management’s year-long platinum jubilee celebration in Jharkhand’s Jamshedpur, on Saturday (December 7, 2024), Mr. Pradhan said India, the fastest-growing global economy, is currently in the fifth position and will bag the third spot in the next three years.

title: NMDFC and DICCI signs MoU to empower marginalised communities through entrepreneurship
subtitle: As part of the MoU, the NMDFC will provide concessional credit to entrepreneurs identified by the DICCI, enabling them to establish businesses and contribute to economic growth
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: NMDFC and DICCI signs MoU to empower marginalised communities through entrepreneurship As part of the MoU, the NMDFC will provide concessional credit to entrepreneurs identified by the DICCI, enabling them to establish businesses and contribute to economic growth The National Minorities Development and Finance Corporation (NMDFC) and the Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (DICCI) on Saturday (December 7, 2024) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to promote entrepreneurship among marginalised communities. Speaking on the occasion, Minister for Minority Affairs, Kiren Rijiju emphasised, “This collaboration between the NMDFC and the DICCI is a significant step towards building an Atmanirbhar Bharat. By promoting entrepreneurship, we are empowering individuals to become job creators and role models, transforming lives and communities across the nation.”

title: Gujarat court acquits ex-IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt in 1997 custodial torture case
subtitle: Bhatt was earlier sentenced to life imprisonment in a 1990 custodial death case in Jamnagar and 20 years in jail in a 1996 case relating to planting drugs to frame a Rajasthan-based lawyer in Palanpur. He is currently lodged in the Rajkot Central Jail
author: Miscellaneous
content: Gujarat court acquits ex-IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt in 1997 custodial torture case Bhatt was earlier sentenced to life imprisonment in a 1990 custodial death case in Jamnagar and 20 years in jail in a 1996 case relating to planting drugs to frame a Rajasthan-based lawyer in Palanpur. He is currently lodged in the Rajkot Central Jail A court in Gujarat's Porbandar has acquitted former IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt in a 1997 custodial torture case, citing that the prosecution could not "prove the case beyond reasonable doubt". Additional chief judicial magistrate Mukesh Pandya on Saturday (December 7, 2024) acquitted Bhatt, the then superintendent of police (SP) of Porbandar, in a case registered against him under IPC sections pertaining to causing grievous hurt to obtain confession and other provisions by giving him the benefit of the doubt due to lack of evidence.

title: Congress demands full discussion on India-China relations in Parliament after External Affairs Minister’s statement on disengagement process
subtitle: The party claims the Narendra Modi government may have agreed to a ‘new normal’ in place of the ‘old normal’ that existed before April 2020
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Congress demands full discussion on India-China relations in Parliament after External Affairs Minister’s statement on disengagement process The party claims the Narendra Modi government may have agreed to a ‘new normal’ in place of the ‘old normal’ that existed before April 2020 Days after the External Affairs Minister (EAM) S. Jaishankar made a suo motostatement in Parliament on the disengagement process with China, the Congress on Sunday claimed that the Narendra Modi government had agreed to a “new normal” over the “old normal” prevailing before April 2020. In a statement, the Congress’s communication chief Jairam Ramesh said Parliament should be allowed to debate the full gamut of the relationship between the two countries. Mr. Ramesh said that it was unfortunate, but typical of the Modi government that “MPs were not permitted to seek any clarifications”.

title:
Sukhbir Singh Badal: The scion after ‘penance’
Premium
subtitle: The former Deputy Chief Minister of Punjab, who survived a bid on his life, seeks to revive the SAD, which suffered back to back electoral setbacks
author: Vikas Vasudeva
content:
Sukhbir Singh Badal: The scion after ‘penance’
Premium The former Deputy Chief Minister of Punjab, who survived a bid on his life, seeks to revive the SAD, which suffered back to back electoral setbacks Sukhbir Singh Badal, the former Deputy Chief Minister of Punjab and president of the Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD), is at the centre of attention after he survived an assassination bid by a pro-Khalistan sympathiser. Mr. Badal, who was found to be tankhaiya, or guilty of religious misconduct, was performing penance for his ‘mistakes’ at the Golden Temple, the central place for worship for the Sikhs in Punjab’s Amritsar, on December 4 when a former militant, Narain Singh, opened fire at him. The two-time former Deputy Chief Minister escaped unhurt as the assailant was overpowered by security personnel.

title: India to create comprehensive anti-drone unit for border security: Amit Shah
subtitle: Addressing BSF troops at the 60th Raising Day event of the force here at its training camp, about 300 km from the India-Pakistan border, Amit Shah said the initial results of a "laser-equipped anti-drone gun-mounted" mechanism have been encouraging
author: Miscellaneous
content: India to create comprehensive anti-drone unit for border security: Amit Shah Addressing BSF troops at the 60th Raising Day event of the force here at its training camp, about 300 km from the India-Pakistan border, Amit Shah said the initial results of a "laser-equipped anti-drone gun-mounted" mechanism have been encouraging Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday (December 8, 2024) said India will soon create a comprehensive anti-drone unit to secure its borders as the "menace" of unmanned aerial vehicles is going to get serious in the coming days. Addressing BSF troops at the 60th Raising Day event of the force here at its training camp, about 300 km from the India-Pakistan border, Mr. Shah said the initial results of a "laser-equipped anti-drone gun-mounted" mechanism have been encouraging.

title: Christian MPs object to amendments in Waqf Bill
subtitle: 20 MPs attend meeting called by CBCI, the apex body of Catholics in India
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Christian MPs object to amendments in Waqf Bill 20 MPs attend meeting called by CBCI, the apex body of Catholics in India The Christian community should highlight its positive points, the important role it played, and “not just be only reactive to negative news”, Christian MPs from the Opposition bloc are learnt to have told the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India (CBCI), a prominent religious body, at a recent meeting held in the national capital. The CBCI, the apex body of Catholics in India, called a meeting of all Christian MPs on December 3. The meet was attended by around 20 MPs, most of them from Opposition parties.

title: Indigenous nuclear attack submarine design to take 4-5 years, another five years for construction
subtitle: Last week, Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi said the first nuclear attack submarine would be ready by 2036-37
author: Dinakar Peri
content: Indigenous nuclear attack submarine design to take 4-5 years, another five years for construction Last week, Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi said the first nuclear attack submarine would be ready by 2036-37 The design phase of the indigenous nuclear attack submarines (SSN) will take four to five years and another five years for the construction of the first one building on the experience of the ballistic nuclear missile submarine programme (SSBN), officials in the know said. Meanwhile, the third SSN leased from Russia is expected to be delivered to the Indian Navy in 2028 after delays. Last week, when asked about the indigenous SSN programme, Navy chief Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi said that “as per their timelines, 2036-37 was the very realistic timeframe when the first SSN can be inducted followed by the second one in a couple of years.”

title: “Mamata Banerjee is an integral part of the INDIA alliance”: NCP-SCP MP Supriya Sule
subtitle: Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi also said that Mamata Banerjee has shown a successful model in West Bengal where she has kept BJP away from power
author: Miscellaneous
content: “Mamata Banerjee is an integral part of the INDIA alliance”: NCP-SCP MP Supriya Sule Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Priyanka Chaturvedi also said that Mamata Banerjee has shown a successful model in West Bengal where she has kept BJP away from power Reacting to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s reported statement about being “willing to lead the INDIA alliance,” Nationalist Congress Party (SCP) MP Supriya Sule said that they will be happy if the TMC chief took on more responsibility within the opposition alliance. Speaking to ANI, Supriya Sule stated that the West Bengal Chief Minister is an integral part of the INDIA alliance.

title: RSS farmers group demands removal of GST on agriculture equipment and inputs
subtitle: In a pre-Budget meeting meeting with the Finance Ministry, BKS demands increase in allocations for the Kisan Samman Nidhi, plus a higher allocation for irrigation projects and agricultural research work
author: Ishita Mishra
content: RSS farmers group demands removal of GST on agriculture equipment and inputs In a pre-Budget meeting meeting with the Finance Ministry, BKS demands increase in allocations for the Kisan Samman Nidhi, plus a higher allocation for irrigation projects and agricultural research work The Bharatiya Kisan Sangh (BKS) has demanded that the Union government completely remove the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on agricultural equipment and inputs, it said in a statement on Saturday (December 7, 2024). Other items on the RSS-affiliated farmers group’s Budget 2025 wishlist include a hike in the payout under the PM Kisan Samman Nidhi, and a higher allocation for agricultural research and rural development. The BKS said that it was invited to a pre-Budget interaction with the Finance Ministry, to discuss what steps the Union government must take towards the development of the country’s agriculture sector and the upliftment of the farmers. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman was also part of the meeting, in which the BKS was represented by its national president Badri Narayan Chaudhary.

title: Sonia Gandhi linked to organisation financed by George Soros Foundation, says BJP
subtitle: Reiterating its allegation about a connection between the Congress party and billionaire George Soros, the BJP — through a thread on X — said it implied “their shared goal of diminishing India’s growth”
author: Devesh K. Pandey
content: Sonia Gandhi linked to organisation financed by George Soros Foundation, says BJP Reiterating its allegation about a connection between the Congress party and billionaire George Soros, the BJP — through a thread on X — said it implied “their shared goal of diminishing India’s growth” The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Sunday (December 8, 2024) alleged that former Congress president Sonia Gandhi, as the co-president of the Forum of Democratic Leaders in the Asia-Pacific (FDL-AP), was linked to an organisation financed by the “George Soros Foundation.” Reiterating its allegation about a connection between the Congress party and billionaire George Soros, the BJP — through a thread on X — said it implied “their shared goal of diminishing India’s growth”.

title: Foreign Secretary Misri to visit Dhaka tomorrow amid frosty India-Bangladesh ties
subtitle: Mr. Misri is scheduled to hold wide-ranging talks with his Bangladeshi counterpart Md. Jashim Uddin and meet the country's de-facto foreign minister Mohammad Touhid Hossain
author: Miscellaneous
content: Foreign Secretary Misri to visit Dhaka tomorrow amid frosty India-Bangladesh ties Mr. Misri is scheduled to hold wide-ranging talks with his Bangladeshi counterpart Md. Jashim Uddin and meet the country's de-facto foreign minister Mohammad Touhid Hossain Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri is expected to raise with Dhaka India's concerns over attacks on Hindus and other minorities as he embarks on a day-long visit to Bangladesh on Monday (December 9, 2024), in the first high-level trip from New Delhi after a massive uprising ended deposed Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15-year rule in August. Mr. Misri is scheduled to hold wide-ranging talks with his Bangladeshi counterpart Md. Jashim Uddin and meet the country's de-facto foreign minister Mohammad Touhid Hossain.

title: Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav: Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia, Sukanta Majumdar walk on the ramp
subtitle: Taking on X social media, Mr. Scindia lauded the talented artists and models from the northeast. He also commended the fashion show that showcased the vibrant styles of Northeast India
author: Miscellaneous
content: Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav: Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia, Sukanta Majumdar walk on the ramp Taking on X social media, Mr. Scindia lauded the talented artists and models from the northeast. He also commended the fashion show that showcased the vibrant styles of Northeast India Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia along with MoS Sukanta Majumdar walked the ramp at the Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav fashion show, at Bharat Mandapam on Saturday (December 7, 2024). Taking on X social media, Mr. Scindia lauded the talented artists and models from the northeast. He also commended the fashion show that showcased the vibrant styles of Northeast India.

title: Bombay HC judge signs his living will on day of his retirement
subtitle: A living will is a legal document specifying the desired medical care one wishes to have if he or she loses the ability to communicate
author: Miscellaneous
content: Bombay HC judge signs his living will on day of his retirement A living will is a legal document specifying the desired medical care one wishes to have if he or she loses the ability to communicate Justice Bharat Deshpande of the Bombay High Court at Goa signed his living will or advanced medical care directive on the day of his retirement. A living will is a legal document specifying the desired medical care one wishes to have if he or she loses the ability to communicate.

title: Centre at Dhaka set on fire, claims ISKCON
subtitle: ISKCON spokesperson said the temple located in Dhour village, under the jurisdiction of Turag Police Station, Dhaka district, was set on fire in the early hours of December 7, 2024
author: Shiv Sahay Singh
content: Centre at Dhaka set on fire, claims ISKCON ISKCON spokesperson said the temple located in Dhour village, under the jurisdiction of Turag Police Station, Dhaka district, was set on fire in the early hours of December 7, 2024 “A centre of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) was set on fire in Dhaka in Bangladesh,” a spokesperson of the religious order said on Saturday (December 7, 2024.) “Early morning today, between 2-3 a.m., miscreants set fire to the Shri Shri Radha Krishna Temple and the Shri Shri Mahabhagya Lakshmi Narayan Temple, which fall under the Hare Krishna Namhatta Sangha, located in Dhour village, under the jurisdiction of Turag Police Station, Dhaka district,” Radharaman Das, the spokesperson of ISKCON Kolkata posted on social media.

title: Rajnath to begin 3-day visit to Russia on December 8, witness commissioning of Indian naval warship
subtitle: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to visit Russia, commission stealth warship, discuss Military cooperation with Russian counterpart
author: Miscellaneous
content: Rajnath to begin 3-day visit to Russia on December 8, witness commissioning of Indian naval warship Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to visit Russia, commission stealth warship, discuss Military cooperation with Russian counterpart Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will embark on a three-day trip to Russia on Sunday (December 8, 2024) to witness the commissioning of a stealth warship into the Indian Navy and hold talks with his Russian counterpart Andrey Belousov on the expansion of bilateral cooperation in co-production of Military hardware. The Russian-manufactured multi-role stealth-guided missile frigate Tushil will be commissioned on Monday (December 9, 2024) in the coastal city of Kaliningrad.

title: Mumbai police receives message threatening attempt on PM Modi's life
subtitle: A WhatsApp message, received on the helpline of the traffic police in the early hours, mentioned two ISI agents and a plot to carry out a bomb blast to target Modi
author: Miscellaneous
content: Mumbai police receives message threatening attempt on PM Modi's life A WhatsApp message, received on the helpline of the traffic police in the early hours, mentioned two ISI agents and a plot to carry out a bomb blast to target Modi Mumbai Police on Saturday (December 7, 2024) received a message threatening to kill Prime Minister Narendra Modi, an official said. The number from which the message was sent was traced to Ajmer in Rajasthan and a police team was sent there immediately to nab the suspect, said an official.

title: Innovative, participative diplomacy can help solving conflicts: Jaishankar
subtitle: Jaishankar also said the era of the 60s and the 70s when the UN Security Council or a few Western powers managed conflicts is “behind us,”
author: Miscellaneous
content: Innovative, participative diplomacy can help solving conflicts: Jaishankar Jaishankar also said the era of the 60s and the 70s when the UN Security Council or a few Western powers managed conflicts is “behind us,” External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar on Saturday (December 7, 2024) called for “more innovative and participative diplomacy” and said the needle is moving towards the reality of negotiations rather than the continuation of the war between Russia and Ukraine. Mr. Jaishankar highlighted the increasing cost of oil, fertilisers and shipping etc. for several countries, including India, due to conflicts in the Gulf and the Mediterranean region.

title: Willing to lead INDIA bloc if given opportunity: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
subtitle: The Trinamool Congress supremo said she could manage the dual responsibilities of running the Opposition front while continuing her role as West Bengal CM
author: Miscellaneous
