content: Willing to lead INDIA bloc if given opportunity: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee The Trinamool Congress supremo said she could manage the dual responsibilities of running the Opposition front while continuing her role as West Bengal CM West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed dissatisfaction with the functioning of the Opposition INDIA bloc, signaling her intent to take charge of the alliance if given an opportunity. The Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo said she could manage the dual responsibilities of running the Opposition front while continuing her role as the Chief Minister of West Bengal.

title: Pope Francis's visit to India likely after Jubilee year 2025, says Union Minister George Kurian
subtitle: Union Minister George Kurian announces that Pope Francis is likely to visit India after 2025 Jubilee Year celebration
author: Miscellaneous
content: Pope Francis's visit to India likely after Jubilee year 2025, says Union Minister George Kurian Union Minister George Kurian announces that Pope Francis is likely to visit India after 2025 Jubilee Year celebration Union Minister of State for Minority Affairs George Kurian on Saturday (December 7, 2024) said the much-awaited visit of Pope Francis to India is likely to happen after 2025, which has been announced as the "Jubilee Year" by the Catholic Church. He noted that India had already invited the Pope officially and Prime Minister Narendra Modi directly extended him the invitation. The rest of the matters and procedures were to be decided by the Vatican. The visit would be scheduled as per the convenience of Pope Francis, he told to the Asianet channel.

title: 73 complaints against vulgar ads on TV channels: Govt tells Parliament
subtitle: The Government addresses complaints against obscene TV ads, implements a three-level grievance redress system, and enforces Code of Ethics for OTT platforms
author: Miscellaneous
content: 73 complaints against vulgar ads on TV channels: Govt tells Parliament The Government addresses complaints against obscene TV ads, implements a three-level grievance redress system, and enforces Code of Ethics for OTT platforms The Government has told Parliament that over the past three years, the regulatory bodies have received seventy-three complaints against obscene and vulgar advertisements on private television channels. In a written reply in the Rajya Sabha, Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting L. Murugan said the complaints were "suitably" addressed by a three-level grievance redress system. Mr. Murugan said that the mechanism, established under the Cable Television Networks (Amendment) Rules, includes self-regulation by broadcasters, self-regulation by self-regulating bodies of the broadcasters, and an oversight mechanism of the Central Government.

title: Travesty of Justice that secularism not given its due in Ayodhya Verdict: former SC Judge Nariman
subtitle: Justice Nariman criticises 2019 Ramjanmabhoomi-Babri Masjid judgment, calls for strict implementation of the Places of Worship Act to prevent disputes
author: Miscellaneous
content: Travesty of Justice that secularism not given its due in Ayodhya Verdict: former SC Judge Nariman Justice Nariman criticises 2019 Ramjanmabhoomi-Babri Masjid judgment, calls for strict implementation of the Places of Worship Act to prevent disputes Former Supreme Court Judge Justice R.F. Nariman has criticised the Supreme Court's 2019 Judgment in the Ramjanmabhoomi-Babri Masjid case, describing it as a "great travesty of Justice" that did not do justice to the principle of secularism. Speaking at the First Justice A.M. Ahmadi Memorial Lecture on 'Secularism and the Indian Constitution', Justice Nariman, however, said the judgment had a "silver lining" as it upheld the Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act 1991. He said the Places of Worship Act should be strictly implemented to put an end to disputes over religious places which are popping up every day across the country like "hydra heads".

title: Uncertainty over participation of Bangladeshi freedom fighters in Eastern Command’s Vijay Diwas celebrations
subtitle: A delegation of senior officers of Bangladesh Armed Forces, along with a group of Mukti Joddhas, had visited Kolkata’s Fort William to take part in the Eastern Command’s Vijay Diwas celebrations
author: Moyurie  Som
content: Uncertainty over participation of Bangladeshi freedom fighters in Eastern Command’s Vijay Diwas celebrations A delegation of senior officers of Bangladesh Armed Forces, along with a group of Mukti Joddhas, had visited Kolkata’s Fort William to take part in the Eastern Command’s Vijay Diwas celebrations Following recent incidents of atrocities against minorities in Bangladesh, uncertainty looms over the participation of Bangladeshi Mukti Joddhas (freedom fighters) in the Indian Armed Forces’ upcoming Vijay Diwas celebrations at Fort William, the headquarters of the Eastern Command, in Kolkata on December 16. Vijay Diwas, celebrated on December 16 every year, marks India’s historic victory over Pakistan in the 1971 war, which led to the formation of Bangladesh from erstwhile East Pakistan.

title: Defence Minister Rajnath on three-day visit to Russia, to oversee commissioning of frigate Tushil
subtitle: Rajnath Singh will pay tributes at ‘The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier’ in Moscow to honour the Soviet soldiers killed during World War-II. He will also interact with the members of the Indian community.
author: Dinakar Peri
content: Defence Minister Rajnath on three-day visit to Russia, to oversee commissioning of frigate Tushil Rajnath Singh will pay tributes at ‘The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier’ in Moscow to honour the Soviet soldiers killed during World War-II. He will also interact with the members of the Indian community. The first of two stealth guided missile frigates, Tushil, under construction in Russia is set to be commissioned during the three-day visit of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh beginning on Sunday (December 8, 2024) for the 21st meeting of India-Russia Inter-Governmental Commission on Military and Military Technical Cooperation (IRIGC-M&MTC). The visit comes ahead of the planned visit of Russian President Vladimir Putin to India early next year for the annual summit level meeting. During the visit, Mr. Singh and his Russian counterpart Andrey Belousov will co-chair the 21st meeting of the IRIGC-M&MTC in Moscow on December 10, a defence ministry statement said. “The two leaders will review the entire range of multi-faceted relations between the two countries in the field of defence, including military-to-military and industrial cooperation. They will also exchange views on contemporary regional and global issues of mutual interest.”

title: Governments before 2014 didn't work whole-heartedly to create welfare State: Amit Shah
subtitle: PM Modi understood the mantra that "development of India cannot happen until its 60 crore population remains poor", and worked to lift 25 crore people from poverty in the last 10 years
author: Miscellaneous
content: Governments before 2014 didn't work whole-heartedly to create welfare State: Amit Shah PM Modi understood the mantra that "development of India cannot happen until its 60 crore population remains poor", and worked to lift 25 crore people from poverty in the last 10 years Governments before 2014 worked piecemeal while trying to achieve the Constitutional objective of a welfare State but this concept was turned into reality by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union minister Amit Shah said on Saturday (December 7, 2024). Mr. Shah said PM Modi understood the mantra that "development of India cannot happen until its 60 crore population remains poor", and worked to lift 25 crore people from poverty in the last 10 years.

title: RJD MP Manoj Jha takes a jibe at Agriculture Minister says ‘a lot of difference between words and reality’
subtitle: RJD MP Manoj Jha criticised Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, urging action on farmers’ demands for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and compensation
author: Miscellaneous
content: RJD MP Manoj Jha takes a jibe at Agriculture Minister says ‘a lot of difference between words and reality’ RJD MP Manoj Jha criticised Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan, urging action on farmers’ demands for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and compensation Rashtriya Janata Dal’s (RJD’s) Rajya Sabha MP Manoj Jha on Saturday (December 7, 2024) took a jibe at Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan for his Parliament address on farmers, saying, “There is a lot of difference between their word and reality.” Speaking with ANI, Mr. Jha criticised the authorities for the use of tear gas on the farmers protesting at the Sambu border with the demands for compensation and a legal guarantee for the minimum support price (MSP).

title: Former President of Chile Michelle Bachelet to be conferred the Indira Gandhi Peace prize
subtitle: The award is in recognition of her work to improve gender equality, human rights and democracy
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Former President of Chile Michelle Bachelet to be conferred the Indira Gandhi Peace prize The award is in recognition of her work to improve gender equality, human rights and democracy The Indira Gandhi Prize for Peace, Disarmament and Development for 2024 will be conferred on former Chilean president and prominent human rights voice Michelle Bachelet, a statement issued by the Indira Gandhi Memorial Trust said on Friday (December 6, 2024). The international jury for the award was chaired by former National Security Adviser Shivshankar Menon.

title: Priyanka slams BJP for calling Rahul ‘traitor’
subtitle: The Congress MP from Wayanad said “nothing is above the country” for Rahul Gandhi. She said the government “does not have the courage” to discuss the alleged bribery issue in Parliament
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Priyanka slams BJP for calling Rahul ‘traitor’ The Congress MP from Wayanad said “nothing is above the country” for Rahul Gandhi. She said the government “does not have the courage” to discuss the alleged bribery issue in Parliament Hitting back at the Bharatyia Janata Party (BJP) for calling Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi “a traitor of the highest order”, Congress leader and Lok Sabha member from Wayanad Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday said that “nothing is bigger for her brother than the country”. “Those who can call Jawaharlal Nehru, who spent 13 years in jail during the Independence struggle, a traitor; those who can call Indira Gandhi, who broke Pakistan into two parts, a traitor; and those who can call Rajiv Gandhi, who was martyred for the country, a traitor, then there is nothing new if they are doing the same with Rahul Gandhi,” Ms. Vadra told reporters outside the Parliament building.

title: Senior officer lists shortcomings of women Commanding Officers, calls for policy on gender neutrality
subtitle: Lt. Gen Rajeev Puri flagged several shortcomings which include poor interpersonal skills, over assertion of command, misplaced sense of entitlement, lack of empathy, exaggerated tendency to complain and over ambition to a lack of ambition.
author: Dinakar Peri
content: Senior officer lists shortcomings of women Commanding Officers, calls for policy on gender neutrality Lt. Gen Rajeev Puri flagged several shortcomings which include poor interpersonal skills, over assertion of command, misplaced sense of entitlement, lack of empathy, exaggerated tendency to complain and over ambition to a lack of ambition. Calling for a “comprehensive policy” on “gender neutrality” as well as gender-neutral assessments of course performance, a senior Army officer listed out findings from a performance review of women Commanding Officers (CO) under his command in the Eastern sector and flagged several shortcomings which include poor interpersonal skills, over assertion of command, misplaced sense of entitlement, lack of empathy, exaggerated tendency to complain and over ambition to a lack of ambition. In a letter to the Eastern Army Commander Lt. Gen R. C. Tiwari dated October 1, 2024, the same which has also been sent to the Army’s Military Secretary (MS) and the Adjutant General’s (AG) branches, Lt. Gen Rajeev Puri who commanded the Panagarh-based 17 mountain strike Corps called for the need to institute certain long term measures in this regard. He completed his tenure in November 2024.

title: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri to land in Dhaka on December 9 as tensions mount
subtitle: This is the first high-profile diplomatic outreach since former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina fled to India; Dhaka recalls Kolkata, Agartala mission chiefs after vandalism by group protesting Hindu monk’s arrest
author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri to land in Dhaka on December 9 as tensions mount This is the first high-profile diplomatic outreach since former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina fled to India; Dhaka recalls Kolkata, Agartala mission chiefs after vandalism by group protesting Hindu monk’s arrest In India’s first high-level diplomatic outreach to Bangladesh since the fall of the Sheikh Hasina-led regime, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri will visit Dhaka on December 9, 2024, the Ministry of External Affairs announced on Friday (December 6, 2024). His visit is part of “structured interactions” with Bangladesh, MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said. Mr. Misri’s daylong visit comes against the backdrop of a heated war of words between the two countries that has escalated in recent weeks, especially regarding attacks against the Hindu minority in Bangladesh.

title: New Kendriya Vidyalayas: PM Modi says government ‘committed to providing school education to every section of society’
subtitle: Mr. Modi said that while the opening of 85 new KVs will benefit a large number of students, many new employment opportunities will also be created.
author: Miscellaneous
content: New Kendriya Vidyalayas: PM Modi says government ‘committed to providing school education to every section of society’ Mr. Modi said that while the opening of 85 new KVs will benefit a large number of students, many new employment opportunities will also be created. Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday (December 7, 2024) said his government has taken another big decision to make school education as accessible as possible with the Cabinet approving the opening of 85 new Kendriya Vidyalayas. He asserted that while the step will benefit a large number of students, many new employment opportunities will also be created.

title: Bomb threat to flights: 16 cases registered in Delhi likely to be transferred to NIA
subtitle: Cases were filed in response to threats to more than 150 domestic and international flights operating from the national capital
author: Miscellaneous
content: Bomb threat to flights: 16 cases registered in Delhi likely to be transferred to NIA Cases were filed in response to threats to more than 150 domestic and international flights operating from the national capital At least 16 cases registered in connection with threats to flights of different airlines operating from Delhi are likely to be transferred to the National Investigation Agency (NIA), officials sources said on Friday (December 6, 2024). It has been learnt that the Delhi Police has written to the city government’s Home Department to transfer the cases to the NIA, they said, adding that it would be further sent to the Union Home Ministry for final approval.

title: India issues travel advisory for Syria, advises citizens to restrict movements
subtitle: This warning comes in light of the situation prevailing in Syria, which poses significant risks to travellers.
author: Miscellaneous
content: India issues travel advisory for Syria, advises citizens to restrict movements This warning comes in light of the situation prevailing in Syria, which poses significant risks to travellers. The Indian government on Friday (December 6, 2024) issued a travel advisory for Syria, strongly advising Indian nationals to avoid all travel to the country until further notice. This warning comes in light of the situation prevailing in Syria, which poses significant risks to travellers. "In view of the situation prevailing in Syria, Indian nationals are advised to avoid all travel to Syria, until further notification," the Ministry of External Affairs said in a press release

title: Yechury contributed to CPI(M)’s understanding of RSS: Prakash Karat
subtitle: Sitaram Yechury’s posthumously published books analyse the RSS and Hindutva, shedding light on their impact on Indian society
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Yechury contributed to CPI(M)’s understanding of RSS: Prakash Karat Sitaram Yechury’s posthumously published books analyse the RSS and Hindutva, shedding light on their impact on Indian society Former Communist Party of India (Marxist) general secretary Sitaram Yechury contributed to the understanding of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) within the party through his study ‘What is this Hindurashtra’, said senior CPI(M) leader Prakash Karat at a function to release three books written by Yechury on Friday (December 6, 2024). The books, a collection of essays written by the late CPI(M) leader, in Hindi and English, were published posthumously by the Safdar Hashmi Memorial Trust, and Tulika Books.

title: India asks Pakistan to shun 'duplicity' on terrorism; demands action against JeM chief Masood Azhar
subtitle: Mr. Randhir Jaiswal also questioned Pakistan's persistent position that Azhar is not in the country
author: Miscellaneous
content: India asks Pakistan to shun 'duplicity' on terrorism; demands action against JeM chief Masood Azhar Mr. Randhir Jaiswal also questioned Pakistan's persistent position that Azhar is not in the country India asked Pakistan on Friday (December 6, 2024) to take strong action against Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) chief Masood Azhar, after reports emerged that he delivered a speech recently at a public gathering in the Pakistani city of Bahawalpur. New Delhi said if the reports of Azhar's location are correct, then Pakistan's "duplicity" has been exposed as it has been maintaining that the JeM chief is not in that country.

title: U.S. State Dept. behind anti-Modi ‘agenda’: BJP
subtitle: It accuses an international group, Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project, of providing the ‘ammunition’ for the agenda and the Congress of using its reports to disrupt Parliament
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: U.S. State Dept. behind anti-Modi ‘agenda’: BJP It accuses an international group, Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project, of providing the ‘ammunition’ for the agenda and the Congress of using its reports to disrupt Parliament The Bharatiya Janata Party alleged that the U.S. State Department was behind the targeted attacks on Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the ruling party and attempts to “destabilise India”. It also accused another group, the Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP), of providing the “ammunition” for the agenda and the Congress of using OCCRP reports to disrupt Parliament. Through a series of posts on X, the party on Thursday (December 5, 2024) said the French investigative media group, Mediapart, revealed that the OCCRP was funded by the U.S. State Department’s USAID, along with other “deep state” figures like George Soros and the Rockefeller Foundation.

title: PM Modi should speak to farmers, enact law to give legal backing to MSP, Congress says
subtitle: The Congress party alleged that the PM Modi-led government is “anti-farmer” citing the Haryana Police firing tear gas shells against the protesting farmers
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: PM Modi should speak to farmers, enact law to give legal backing to MSP, Congress says The Congress party alleged that the PM Modi-led government is “anti-farmer” citing the Haryana Police firing tear gas shells against the protesting farmers Prime Minister Narendra Modi should invite farmers for talks, accept their demand to provide a legal backing to minimum support price (MSP) of agriculture produce and enact a law in the ongoing Winter Session of Parliament, the Congress said on Friday (December 6, 2024). Addressing a press conference Congress general secretary Randeep Surjewala alleged that the Narendra Modi government is “anti-farmer” as it is not willing to listen to the voice of farmers.

title: CJI-led Special Bench to hear challenges against Places of Worship Act on December 12
subtitle: Slew of petitioners seek to “reclaim” places of worship “encroached” by Muslim “invaders”; Muslim groups note that “grievances” against Mughal rulers cannot be used to challenge the validity of an Act of Parliament
author: Krishnadas Rajagopal
content: CJI-led Special Bench to hear challenges against Places of Worship Act on December 12 Slew of petitioners seek to “reclaim” places of worship “encroached” by Muslim “invaders”; Muslim groups note that “grievances” against Mughal rulers cannot be used to challenge the validity of an Act of Parliament Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna has constituted a Special Bench to hear petitions challenging the validity of the Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act of 1991, a statute that has protected the identity and character of religious sites as they existed on August 15, 1947. The three-judge Bench will be headed by Chief Justice Khanna, and also include Justices Sanjay Kumar and K.V. Viswanathan. The first hearing of the case is scheduled for December 12 at 3:30 p.m.

title: Lok Sabha plunges into chaos again as BJP MP reiterates Soros-Congress ‘link’
subtitle: Congress asks govt. why Nishikant Dubey was allowed to speak again in violation of parliamentary rules
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Lok Sabha plunges into chaos again as BJP MP reiterates Soros-Congress ‘link’ Congress asks govt. why Nishikant Dubey was allowed to speak again in violation of parliamentary rules Friday’s Lok Sabha proceedings were washed out as BJP MP Nishikant Dubey, for the second time in as many days, accused the Congress of being in league with U.S.-based billionaire investor George Soros to derail India’s success story under Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The Congress, in turn, asked the government if it really wanted the House to function, as it allowed Mr. Dubey to speak even after the Opposition members met Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Thursday, seeking an apology from the BJP MP.

title: EPFO services win India international award
subtitle: Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation wins ISSA award for efficient communication, e-proceedings, outreach programs, multilingual call centers, and pension order delivery initiative
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: EPFO services win India international award Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation wins ISSA award for efficient communication, e-proceedings, outreach programs, multilingual call centers, and pension order delivery initiative India has bagged International Social Security Association’s (ISSA) ‘Good Practice Award’ for Asia and Pacific for this year for five services provided by Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). ISSA president Dr. Mohammed Azman presented the award to the EPFO at the Regional Social Security Forum held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, earlier this week. The EPFO received five ‘Certificates of Merit’ for running ‘efficient’ communication channels, conduct of E-proceedings, outreach programme Nidhi Aapke Nikat, running multilingual call centres, and pension order delivery initiative Prayaas.

title: Donald Trump administration deserves lot of credit for Quad, says Jaishankar
subtitle: The External Affairs Minister said the standoff with China impacted the relationship between the two countries, and following the disengagement, there is a need for de-escalation because “there’s still a very large number of forces” at the border areas.
author: Dinakar Peri
content: Donald Trump administration deserves lot of credit for Quad, says Jaishankar The External Affairs Minister said the standoff with China impacted the relationship between the two countries, and following the disengagement, there is a need for de-escalation because “there’s still a very large number of forces” at the border areas. The Trump administration deserves a “lot of the credit” for the takeoff of Quad in its second iteration, External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar said on Friday (December 6, 2024). He said the U.S. President-elect’s concerns on alliances and burden sharing do not apply to the quadrilateral grouping as everyone contributes a “fair share”. Mr. Jaishankar said the standoff with China impacted the relationship between the two countries, and following the disengagement, there is a need for de-escalation because “there’s still a very large number of forces” at the border areas.

title: New duty, rest hours for pilots can be implemented from July 2025: DGCA to Delhi HC
subtitle: The new rules, notified in January, would increase the weekly rest for pilots from 36 hours to 48 hours, and reduce their night-time flying. Implementation has been delayed by over six months after opposition from airlines
author: Jagriti Chandra,
content: New duty, rest hours for pilots can be implemented from July 2025: DGCA to Delhi HC The new rules, notified in January, would increase the weekly rest for pilots from 36 hours to 48 hours, and reduce their night-time flying. Implementation has been delayed by over six months after opposition from airlines The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) informed the Delhi High Court on Friday (December 6, 2024) that the new norms providing enhanced weekly rest and reduced night-time flying for pilots to help them combat rising fatigue levels could only be implemented from July 2025 in a phased manner. The implementation of the revised rules governing duty and rest hours for pilots has already been delayed by more than six months.

title: Delhi HC seeks Centre’s stand on Swamy’s plea over Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship
subtitle: “We want to have the assistance of the counsel from the state before we pass any order,” the court says
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Delhi HC seeks Centre’s stand on Swamy’s plea over Rahul Gandhi’s citizenship “We want to have the assistance of the counsel from the state before we pass any order,” the court says The Delhi High Court on Friday (December 6, 2024) asked the Centre to state its stand on BJP leader Subramanian Swamy’s plea seeking directions to the Ministry of Home Affairs to decide over Congress leader Rahul Gandhi’s Indian citizenship. “We want to have the assistance of the counsel from the state before we pass any order,” the court said. The court has now posted the hearing for January 13, 2025.

title: ‘Delhi Chalo’ march highlights: Farmers stopped at Shambhu border, police fire tear gas shells
subtitle: Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher announces suspension of ‘Delhi Chalo’ march for the day as many farmers got injured
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Delhi Chalo’ march highlights: Farmers stopped at Shambhu border, police fire tear gas shells Farmer leader Sarwan Singh Pandher announces suspension of ‘Delhi Chalo’ march for the day as many farmers got injured

title: NCB secures conviction of accused in six drug seizure cases
subtitle: No Subtitle
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: NCB secures conviction of accused in six drug seizure cases No Subtitle The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has secured conviction of the accused in six cases of drug seizures in different parts of the country. On March 31, 2021, 332 kg of ganja was seized from a vehicle at Pedda Amberpet, Hyderabad. The vehicle was driven by Anil Babruwan Kale, who was transporting the consignment from Sileru, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, to Pune and Osmanabad.

title: Congress MP submits privilege notice against BJP's Patra for 'traitor' barb at Rahul Gandhi
subtitle: Congress MP Manickam Tagore had on Thursday written to Mr. Birla, expressing deep concern over Mr. Patra allegedly using "slanderous language" against Mr. Gandhi at a media interaction
author: Miscellaneous
content: Congress MP submits privilege notice against BJP's Patra for 'traitor' barb at Rahul Gandhi Congress MP Manickam Tagore had on Thursday written to Mr. Birla, expressing deep concern over Mr. Patra allegedly using "slanderous language" against Mr. Gandhi at a media interaction Congress MP Hibi Eden has submitted a notice to move a privilege motion against BJP MP Sambit Patra for his remarks calling Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi "traitor of the highest order", asserting that the usage of "completely defamatory and unparliamentary words" has clearly violated constitutional norms. In his letter to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, Mr. Eden said, "I wish to raise a motion of privilege and bring to your attention the completely unparliamentary conduct of Sambit Patra, MP Lok Sabha, against the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi." In a press conference held on December 5, Mr. Patra has referred to the Leader of Opposition as "traitor of the highest order" while making unfounded allegations against the LoP, he said.

title: Farmers postpone march to Delhi after Haryana police use tear gas
subtitle: Pushing through the police barricades, they had attempted to resume their foot march to lay siege to the national capital.
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Farmers postpone march to Delhi after Haryana police use tear gas Pushing through the police barricades, they had attempted to resume their foot march to lay siege to the national capital. Protesting farmers announced the suspension of their “Delhi Chalo” march after the Haryana Police used tear gas to disperse them at Shambhu on the Punjab-Haryana border on Friday (December 6, 2024). Pushing through the police barricades, they had attempted to resume their foot march to lay siege to the national capital. The farmers had also attempted to march to the national capital on February 13 and 21 but were stopped by police personnel at Shambhu and Khanauri on the Punjab-Haryana border. They were pressing for the fulfilment of their demands, with a legal guarantee for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm loan waiver being the key ones.

title: PM Modi inaugurates Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav with a focus on  northeastern States
subtitle: Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav is a three-day cultural festival highlighting the eight States of the Northeast, being celebrated for the first time from December 6 to 8 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi
author: Miscellaneous
content: PM Modi inaugurates Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav with a focus on  northeastern States Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav is a three-day cultural festival highlighting the eight States of the Northeast, being celebrated for the first time from December 6 to 8 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated the Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav in New Delhi with a focus on the Northeastern States. “Ashtalakshmi Mahotsav is a celebration of a better future of the Northeast,” the Prime Minister said. He said that after the West-centric period, the 21st century belongs to the East, more specifically Asia and India. Mr. Modi expressed his firm belief that in the times to come, India’s growth story will encompass eastern India and the Northeast in particular.

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea against politicians contesting Bar elections
subtitle: The Bench asked whether the petitioner was looking to oust senior advocates Kapil Sibal and Manan Kumar Mishra as the current SCBA president and BCI chairperson, respectively
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea against politicians contesting Bar elections The Bench asked whether the petitioner was looking to oust senior advocates Kapil Sibal and Manan Kumar Mishra as the current SCBA president and BCI chairperson, respectively The Supreme Court of India on Friday (December 6, 2024) refused to entertain a petition against ‘active’ members of political parties contesting Bar elections and holding office in the Bar Council of India and States Bar Councils. Petitioner-advocate Jaya Sukin said serving judicial officers, government employees and Defence personnel are not allowed to join political parties or contesting elections.

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Modi govt will purchase all farm produce at MSP, says Agriculture Minister in Rajya Sabha
subtitle: Agriculture Minister also claimed the Modi government is already giving remunerative prices to farmers, saying that paddy wheat, jowar, soyabean were being purchased at 50% above the cost of production
author: Miscellaneous
content: Parliamentary proceedings: Modi govt will purchase all farm produce at MSP, says Agriculture Minister in Rajya Sabha Agriculture Minister also claimed the Modi government is already giving remunerative prices to farmers, saying that paddy wheat, jowar, soyabean were being purchased at 50% above the cost of production The Narendra Modi government will purchase all farm produce at minimum support price, Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said in Rajya Sabha on Friday (December 6, 2024). He gave the assurance while answering supplementaries during Question Hour on the issue of MSP to farmers.

title: Union Cabinet clears 85 new Kendriya Vidyalayas, 28 Navodaya Vidyalayas
subtitle: The Ministry estimated that with the capacity of each KV at 960 students, the announcement would benefit 82,560 additional students
author: Jagriti Chandra
content: Union Cabinet clears 85 new Kendriya Vidyalayas, 28 Navodaya Vidyalayas The Ministry estimated that with the capacity of each KV at 960 students, the announcement would benefit 82,560 additional students The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs on Friday approved the opening of 85 new Kendriya Vidyalayas and 28 Navodaya Vidyalayas. The total funds required for the new Kendriya Vidyalayas (KVs) are estimated at ₹5,872.08 crore over a period of eight years from 2025-26. This includes capital expenditure component of ₹2,862.71 crore and operational expenditure of ₹3,009.37 crore, according to a press statement issued by the Ministry of Education. The existing KV in Shivamogga would be expanded, it said.

title: Proud of my brother, nothing above country for him: Priyanka slams BJP over 'traitor' slur
subtitle: Those who can call Jawaharlal Nehru, who spent 13 years in jail during the Independence struggle, a traitor...they are doing the same with Rahul Gandhi then there is nothing new in it, says Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra
author: Miscellaneous
content: Proud of my brother, nothing above country for him: Priyanka slams BJP over 'traitor' slur Those who can call Jawaharlal Nehru, who spent 13 years in jail during the Independence struggle, a traitor...they are doing the same with Rahul Gandhi then there is nothing new in it, says Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra lashed out at the BJP on Friday (December 6, 2024) over its leader Sambit Patra calling Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi a "traitor". She asserted that nothing is above the country for her brother.

title: Farmers' march: Delhi Police on alert, security deployed at border points
subtitle: The Ambala administration has imposed Section 163 of the BNSS restricting the assembly of five or more persons in the district and has issued notices at the protest site near the Shambhu border
author: Miscellaneous
content: Farmers' march: Delhi Police on alert, security deployed at border points The Ambala administration has imposed Section 163 of the BNSS restricting the assembly of five or more persons in the district and has issued notices at the protest site near the Shambhu border Delhi Police has tightened security at borders ahead of the Punjab farmers' Friday (December 6, 2024) march to the national capital. "Delhi Police is on alert and security has been tightened at the border points of the city. A skeletal deployment has been made at the Singhu Border but it may increase as per the situation at the Shambu border on the Punjab-Haryana border," a senior police officer told PTI.

title: Investments in India profitable; Russian firms ready to set up manufacturing operations: Putin
subtitle: Putin hails ‘Make in India,’ calls investments profitable, praises Modi’s policies, and highlights India-first approach
author: Miscellaneous
content: Investments in India profitable; Russian firms ready to set up manufacturing operations: Putin Putin hails ‘Make in India,’ calls investments profitable, praises Modi’s policies, and highlights India-first approach Russian President Vladimir Putin has hailed 'Make in India' initiative and the Prime Minister Narendra Modi-led Government's policies, saying companies are eager to set up manufacturing facilities in India as investments are profitable. Speaking at the 15th Vneshtorgbank (VTB) Investment Forum in Moscow on Wednesday (December 4, 2024), Mr. Putin said that the initiative, which is aimed at boosting manufacturing and attracting foreign investment, has played a key role in strengthening India's position in the global economy.

title: AgustaWestland chopper scam: SC agrees to hear regular bail plea of Christian Michel in January
subtitle: A Bench of Vikram Nath and P.B. Varale issued notice to the Central Bureau of Investigation returnable in four weeks
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: AgustaWestland chopper scam: SC agrees to hear regular bail plea of Christian Michel in January A Bench of Vikram Nath and P.B. Varale issued notice to the Central Bureau of Investigation returnable in four weeks The Supreme Court on Friday (December 6, 2024) agreed to examine a plea for regular bail filed by Christian Michel James, the alleged middleman in the AgustaWestland chopper scam. A Bench of Vikram Nath and P.B. Varale issued notice to the Central Bureau of Investigation returnable in four weeks.

title: Lakhs of followers, Maharashtra’s top leaders pay homage to B.R Ambedkar
subtitle: Lakhs of followers of Dr Ambedkar converged at his memorial 'Chaityabhoomi' at Shivaji Park in Mumbai's Dadar area to pay tributes to the social reformer on his death anniversary, observed as the 'Mahaparinirvan Din'.
author: Snehal Mutha
content: Lakhs of followers, Maharashtra’s top leaders pay homage to B.R Ambedkar Lakhs of followers of Dr Ambedkar converged at his memorial 'Chaityabhoomi' at Shivaji Park in Mumbai's Dadar area to pay tributes to the social reformer on his death anniversary, observed as the 'Mahaparinirvan Din'. Lakhs of followers of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar converged at his memorial 'Chaityabhoomi' at Shivaji Park in Mumbai's Dadar area to pay tributes to the social reformer on his death anniversary, observed as the 'Mahaparinirvan Din' on Friday (December 6, 2024). Governor C.P. Radhakrishnan and Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis were among the top leaders who paid tributes.

title: Rahul Gandhi assures citizens' delegation to take up air pollution issue in Parliament
subtitle: He said the air pollution crisis needs a collective national response, not political blame games
author: Miscellaneous
content: Rahul Gandhi assures citizens' delegation to take up air pollution issue in Parliament He said the air pollution crisis needs a collective national response, not political blame games A delegation comprising concerned citizens and experts met Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi over the worsening air pollution crisis and outlined practical steps to tackle this "public health emergency". During the meeting in the Parliament House premises, the former Congress chief assured them that he would raise the issue in Parliament and advocate for immediate action on their demands.

title: Amid protests over incidents in Bangladesh, Suvendu calls for ‘Hindu unity’ in Bengal
subtitle: Political observers feel that after the drubbing in the Lok Sabha polls and Assembly bypolls the BJP leadership in West Bengal sees developments in Bangladesh as an opportunity.
author: Shiv Sahay Singh
content: Amid protests over incidents in Bangladesh, Suvendu calls for ‘Hindu unity’ in Bengal Political observers feel that after the drubbing in the Lok Sabha polls and Assembly bypolls the BJP leadership in West Bengal sees developments in Bangladesh as an opportunity. As developments in Bangladesh continue to dominate political discourse in West Bengal, about 50 Hindutva organisations, accompanied by senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders, held a gathering at Esplanade on Thursday and called for “Hindu unity” in the State. Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari said that unlike other states, Hindus are not united in West Bengal. “In Uttar Pradesh Hindus have united under Yogi Adityanath ji, in Haryana Hindus have united, and now in Maharashtra, the land of Chatrapati Shivaji, Hindus have united,” Mr. Adhikari said, addressing a rally at Kolkata’s Rani Rashmoni Road. Since the arrest of ISKCON monk Chinmoy Krishna Das in Bangladesh on November 25, the West Bengal BJP leadership has been organising protests across the State.  Observers feel the BJP sees an opportunity in the unrest across the border after its dismal performance in West Bengal in the Lok Sabha polls. The party’s seats dropped from 18 to 12, and additionally it received a drubbing in the bypolls across 10 Assembly seats.

title: At ICJ hearing, India slams developed nations for climate crisis
subtitle: It said developing nations were the hardest hit by climate change, despite contributing the least to it
author: Miscellaneous
content: At ICJ hearing, India slams developed nations for climate crisis It said developing nations were the hardest hit by climate change, despite contributing the least to it India slammed developed countries for causing the climate crisis during a landmark hearing at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on Thursday, saying they exploited the global carbon budget, failed to honour climate finance promises and are now demanding that developing countries restrict their resource use. The court is examining what legal obligations countries have to address climate change and the consequences if they fail.

title: Indian businesses should not be excessively dependent on one supply chain: Jaishankar on trade with China
subtitle: Mr. Jaishankar said India doesn't want to "end up as a market for another economy and not be able to compete with their products, which are dumped in our country"
author: Miscellaneous
content: Indian businesses should not be excessively dependent on one supply chain: Jaishankar on trade with China Mr. Jaishankar said India doesn't want to "end up as a market for another economy and not be able to compete with their products, which are dumped in our country" Indian businesses should take a "balanced" approach in dealing with China as excessive dependence on its supply chain could be detrimental to India's national interest, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Thursday (December 5, 2024). In an interactive session at industry chamber Assocham, he said the recent resolution of the issues in the remaining friction points along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in eastern Ladakh has resulted in "some progress" but there is a need for further discussions.

title: Supreme Court to hear plea to reduce water level at Mullaperiyar dam in January 2025
subtitle: The petition filed by advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara referred to the recent landslides in Wayanad, which claimed over 220 lives, making it one of the worst natural disasters in recent times.
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Supreme Court to hear plea to reduce water level at Mullaperiyar dam in January 2025 The petition filed by advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara referred to the recent landslides in Wayanad, which claimed over 220 lives, making it one of the worst natural disasters in recent times. The Supreme Court on Friday (December 6,  2024) fixed in January a detailed hearing of a petition seeking to bring down the permissible water level of the Mullaperiyar Dam, situated in the Cardamom Hills of the Western Ghats, from 142 ft to 120 ft to obviate the possibility of the dam breaching. A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Ujjal Bhuyyan asked petitioner-advocate Mathews J. Nedumpara, who appeared online, to come and present his case in person in court.

title: Rajya Sabha erupts over currency notes found in seat of Congress MP; Singhvi calls it ‘bizarre’
subtitle: The assertion triggered an uproar from the Opposition benches, with Leader of Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge saying the Chairman should not have named the member without the investigation being completed.
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Rajya Sabha erupts over currency notes found in seat of Congress MP; Singhvi calls it ‘bizarre’ The assertion triggered an uproar from the Opposition benches, with Leader of Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge saying the Chairman should not have named the member without the investigation being completed. Sparking an uproar in the Rajya Sabha on Friday, Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar said that a wad of currency notes had been found on the seat allotted to Congress MP Abhishek Manu Singhvi on Thursday, during a routine “anti-sabotage check” by security officials. With the treasury and Opposition benches trading allegations and slogan-shouting BJP MPs storming into the well, the House was adjourned for the day around 2 p.m. when it reconvened after lunch.

title: Hashimpura massacre case 1987: Supreme Court grants bail to eight convicts
subtitle: Senior advocate Tiwari, representing four of the appellants, argued that the appellants have been in jail for more than six years since the High Court’s judgment
author: Miscellaneous
content: Hashimpura massacre case 1987: Supreme Court grants bail to eight convicts Senior advocate Tiwari, representing four of the appellants, argued that the appellants have been in jail for more than six years since the High Court’s judgment The Supreme Court of India on Friday (December 6, 2024) granted bail to eight convicts in the infamous 1987 Hashimpura massacre case of 38 persons by the personnel of the Provincial Armed Constabulary. A Bench comprising Justices Abhay S. Oka and Augustine George Masih took note of the submissions of senior advocate Amit Anand Tiwari, appearing for four convicts, that they are suffering prolonged incarceration after the Delhi High Court reversed their acquittal by the trial court in the case.

title: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar
subtitle: Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). title: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister
subtitle: Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy S.M. Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure. title: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others
subtitle: The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). The agency has submitted the prosecution complaint against Sikandar Singh, son of former MLA Dharam Singh Chokker, Mahira Infatech Private Limited, D S Home Construction Private Limited, and others.

title: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister
subtitle: Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy S.M. Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure. Political, business leaders condole the death of former Karnataka CM S.M. Krishna | LIVE

Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure. Political, business leaders condole the death of former Karnataka CM S.M. Krishna | LIVE

title: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar
subtitle: Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

author: Miscellaneous
content: Parliament adjourned for the day; BJP-Congress clash over Adani, Soros issues BJP leaders accused the Congress party of colluding with billionaire George Soros Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) accused the Congress and its leadership of colluding with U.S. billionaire George Soros and anti-India forces, plunging the Lok Sabha into chaos and leading to its adjournment for the day. Speaking during Zero Hour, Mr. Rijiju also hit out at Congress leaders for attacking the dignity of Parliament by coming to the House by wearing masks and jackets with caricatures.

title: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge
subtitle: Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said
author: Peerzada Ashiq
content: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said National Conference MP Aga Syed Ruhullah on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said he would move an impeachment motion in Parliament against Justice Shekhar K. Yadav, sitting judge in the Allahabad High Court, over the latter’s recent remarks against Muslims. “I am moving impeachment motion in the Parliament in accordance with Art 124(4) of the constitution for the removal of this Justice namely Shekhar K Yadav, a sitting Judge in Hon’ble High Court of Judicature at Allahabad on the charges mentioned in the notice,”,” Mr. Ruhullah said.

title: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others
subtitle: The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). The agency has submitted the prosecution complaint against Sikandar Singh, son of former MLA Dharam Singh Chokker, Mahira Infatech Private Limited, D S Home Construction Private Limited, and others.

title: Opposition protests Adani issue in Parliament premises with black bags
subtitle: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, MPs from the Congress, DMK, JMM, Left, among others, protested with bag blacks with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and ‘Modi Adani Bhai Bhai’ written on the obverse side
author: Miscellaneous
content: Opposition protests Adani issue in Parliament premises with black bags Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, MPs from the Congress, DMK, JMM, Left, among others, protested with bag blacks with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and ‘Modi Adani Bhai Bhai’ written on the obverse side Several opposition MPs on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) demonstrated over the Adani issue in Parliament premises, carrying black 'jholas' (bags) with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and 'Modi Adani Bhai Bhai' written on the obverse side. author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Justice Yadav’s speech at VHP event: Supreme Court takes note, seeks details from Allahabad HC Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav attended an event organised by VHP and spoke on the subject of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) The Supreme Court on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) took note of the reports related to a sitting Allahabad High Court Judge Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav’s speech at a Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) event and sought details from the Allahabad High Court. author: Miscellaneous

title: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister
subtitle: Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy
author: Suhasini Haidar
content: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy S.M. Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure. Political, business leaders condole the death of former Karnataka CM S.M. Krishna | LIVE

title: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar
subtitle: Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sixteen-fold rise in urban sector investments since 2014, says Manohar Lal Khattar Manohar Lal Khattar said a new rental housing vertical has been introduced under the second phase of the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban), benefiting the migrant population Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said there has been a substantial increase in investments in the urban sector since 2014 and emphasised the Centre’s dedication to realising the vision of ‘Viksit Bharat’ by 2047. Addressing a press conference on achievements of his Ministry, the Union Housing and Urban Affairs Minister said investments have increased 16-fold, rising from approximately ₹1,78,053 crore between 2004 and 2014 to ₹28,52,527 crore since 2014.

title: Parliament adjourned for the day; BJP-Congress clash over Adani, Soros issues
subtitle: BJP leaders accused the Congress party of colluding with billionaire George Soros
author: Miscellaneous
content: Parliament adjourned for the day; BJP-Congress clash over Adani, Soros issues BJP leaders accused the Congress party of colluding with billionaire George Soros Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) accused the Congress and its leadership of colluding with U.S. billionaire George Soros and anti-India forces, plunging the Lok Sabha into chaos and leading to its adjournment for the day. Speaking during Zero Hour, Mr. Rijiju also hit out at Congress leaders for attacking the dignity of Parliament by coming to the House by wearing masks and jackets with caricatures.

title: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge
subtitle: Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said
author: Peerzada Ashiq
content: NC MP Aga Syed Ruhullah seeks to move impeachment motion against Allahabad High Court judge Justice Yadav’s political biases, deep-rooted communalism render him incapable of serving as a non-partisan judge, Aga Syed Ruhullah said National Conference MP Aga Syed Ruhullah on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) said he would move an impeachment motion in Parliament against Justice Shekhar K. Yadav, sitting judge in the Allahabad High Court, over the latter’s recent remarks against Muslims. “I am moving impeachment motion in the Parliament in accordance with Art 124(4) of the constitution for the removal of this Justice namely Shekhar K Yadav, a sitting Judge in Hon’ble High Court of Judicature at Allahabad on the charges mentioned in the notice,”,” Mr. Ruhullah said.

title: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others
subtitle: The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Court takes cognisance of ED’s complaint against son of Haryana MLA, others The accused entities failed to deliver houses to buyers, missed multiple deadlines, and diverted money collected from home-buyers for their personal gains, the ED said A special court has taken cognisance of the prosecution complaint filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against the son of a Haryana MLA and others in connection with a case alleging they were involved in cheating a large number home buyers, the agency said on Tuesday (December 10, 2024). The agency has submitted the prosecution complaint against Sikandar Singh, son of former MLA Dharam Singh Chokker, Mahira Infatech Private Limited, D S Home Construction Private Limited, and others.

author: Miscellaneous
content: Opposition submits notice for moving no-confidence motion against Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar Congress leaders Jairam Ramesh and Naseer Hussain submitted the notice to Rajya Sabha Secretary-General P.C. Mody Opposition parties on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) submitted a notice to move a motion for removing Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar for allegedly conducting the House in a partisan manner. title: Opposition protests Adani issue in Parliament premises with black bags
subtitle: Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, MPs from the Congress, DMK, JMM, Left, among others, protested with bag blacks with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and ‘Modi Adani Bhai Bhai’ written on the obverse side
author: Miscellaneous
content: Opposition protests Adani issue in Parliament premises with black bags Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, MPs from the Congress, DMK, JMM, Left, among others, protested with bag blacks with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and ‘Modi Adani Bhai Bhai’ written on the obverse side Several opposition MPs on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) demonstrated over the Adani issue in Parliament premises, carrying black 'jholas' (bags) with caricatures of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and billionaire Gautam Adani printed on it and 'Modi Adani Bhai Bhai' written on the obverse side. This is the latest in the series of  protests led by the Congress daily ahead of the sitting of Parliament in the morning.

title: Justice Yadav’s speech at VHP event: Supreme Court takes note, seeks details from Allahabad HC
subtitle: Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav attended an event organised by VHP and spoke on the subject of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC)
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Justice Yadav’s speech at VHP event: Supreme Court takes note, seeks details from Allahabad HC Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav attended an event organised by VHP and spoke on the subject of the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) The Supreme Court on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) took note of the reports related to a sitting Allahabad High Court Judge Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav’s speech at a Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) event and sought details from the Allahabad High Court. content: S.M. Krishna will be remembered for his grace as External Affairs Minister Officials who served with S.M. Krishna recall his tenure during crucial years for Indian diplomacy S.M. Krishna’s tenure as Minister of External Affairs (2009-2011) is often remembered for gaffes, like the time in 2011 when he accidentally began to read out the Portuguese Foreign Minister’s speech at the United Nations, but diplomats and journalists covering Indian Foreign Policy have lasting memories of Mr. Krishna’s grace and “old style of politics  and diplomacy” in what was a particularly tense second term for the Manmohan Singh-led UPA government, and his ability to deal with crisis without showing the pressure. author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Japanese company to demo futuristic bathing capsule in 2025 A Japanese company is getting ready to demonstrate an AI-powered bathing capsule that can clean and dry off humans while also helping them relax Japanese shower-head maker Science Co. is getting ready to demo an AI-powered bathing capsule that can clean and dry off people who sit inside it, reported the news outlet Asahi Shimbum. The AI-powered capsule that the company dubs a futuristic “washing machine” for humans is still being developed for real-time use. It will be exhibited during the Osaka Kansai Expo in April 2025, where visitors who sign up can try it out.

author: Miscellaneous
content: The Onion’s bid for Infowars is still in Court as Judge reviews auction The Onion’s bid to buy conspiracy theorist Alex Jones’ Infowars is back in a Texas courtroom A bankruptcy Judge scrutinising The Onion’s bid for Alex Jones ’ Infowars platform was expected to hear a second day of testimony on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) after an auctioneer defended the satirical news outlet’s winning offer in November 2024. It is not clear how quickly U.S. Bankruptcy Judge Christopher Lopez in Houston will decide whether to approve the bid. The Onion, which wants to turn Infowars’ website and social media accounts into parodies, offered $1.75 million for Infowars’ assets in the auction.

Roger Carstens, the special presidential envoy for hostage affairs, is talking to officials in the region following the overthrow of Bashar Assad’s Government to find out where Mr. Tice is and “get him home as soon as possible”, State Department spokesman Matthew Miller told the reporters on Monday (Dec. 9).

author: Miscellaneous
content: Soros’ Open Society Foundations say they remain focused on human rights George Soros’ philanthropy, Open Society Foundations, will continue to fund human rights movements around the world Despite years of internal turmoil and changes, Open Society Foundations wants those in the human rights sector to know their movements will still receive support from the organization, its president Binaifer Nowrojee said Tuesday (December 10, 2024). The foundations, founded by billionaire investor George Soros and now led by one of his sons, Alex Soros, have historically been one of the largest funders of human rights groups. But since 2021, they closed some of their programs and reduced their staff as part of a major internal reorganization.

author: Miscellaneous
content: Mass evacuation of Philippine villages under way after brief but major volcanic eruption “The mass evacuations were being carried out urgently in towns and villages nearest the western and southern slopes of Kanlaon which were blanketed by its ash,” the Office of Civil Defence said About 87,000 people were being evacuated in a central Philippine region on Tuesday (December 10, 2024) a day after a volcano briefly erupted with a towering ash plume and superhot streams of gas and debris hurtling down its western slopes. The latest eruption of Mount Kanlaon on central Negros island did not cause any immediate casualties, but the alert level was raised one level, indicating further and more explosive eruptions may occur.

content: Elon Musk warns Republicans against standing in Donald Trump's way — or his Elon Musk backs Donald Trump with significant Political Action Committee funding and influence, pressuring Grand Old Party lawmakers to align with Mr. Trump’s agenda A week after President-elect Donald Trump's victory, Elon Musk said his political action committee would “play a significant role in primaries.” The following week, the billionaire responded to a report that he might fund challengers to Grand Old Party (GOP) House members who don't support Mr. Trump's nominees. “How else? title:
Twelve days that shook Syria
Premium
subtitle: The rapid collapse of government forces in Aleppo stunned both the militants and the regime alike
author: Stanly Johny
content:
Twelve days that shook Syria
Premium The rapid collapse of government forces in Aleppo stunned both the militants and the regime alike The Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), the Syrian Islamist militant group, had been preparing for months for a large-scale offensive against regime forces. The civil war was quiet for years, particularly after the regime of President Bashar al-Assad captured most of its lost territories — including Aleppo, Hama and Homs. The HTS, formerly al-Nusra Front, the Syrian arm of al-Qaeda, had built a statelet in Idlib, in northwestern Syria, under the leadership of its ‘emir’, Abu Muhammed al-Jolani. The HTS and its ally Syrian National Army (SNA), formerly the Free Syrian Army, had informed Turkiye, their patron, at least six months ago about the offensive plan, according to a Reuters report. And Ankara had given its tacit approval. Mr. Assad’s troops were in a bad shape. Soldiers were poorly paid and lacked motivation. The country never recovered from the scars of the civil war. Under crippling American sanctions, its finances were in shambles. During the peak of the civil war, in 2015-16, Mr. Assad had heavily relied on his external allies for security — Russia, Iran and Hezbollah. Now, the situation was different. The Russians were focused on Ukraine. Iran lost a host of its Syria commanders to Israeli strikes. Hezbollah had been weakened in a year-long war with Israel. The HTS launched its offensive on November 27, the day Israel and Lebanon signed a ceasefire. On the 12th day, the Assad regime fell, sending tremors across the region.

title: Tulsi Gabbard, Trump's pick for Intel Chief who visited Assad, meets with Senators after dictator’s fall
subtitle: Tulsi Gabbard, President-elect Trump’s Director of National Intelligence (DNI) pick, meets Senators, supports Trump’s Syria stance and faces confirmation questions
author: Miscellaneous
content: Tulsi Gabbard, Trump's pick for Intel Chief who visited Assad, meets with Senators after dictator’s fall Tulsi Gabbard, President-elect Trump’s Director of National Intelligence (DNI) pick, meets Senators, supports Trump’s Syria stance and faces confirmation questions Tulsi Gabbard, President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to be the Director of National Intelligence (DNI), has met key Senators at Capitol Hill and supported the Republican leader's view on Syria amid the sudden fall of the country's Assad rule. Hindu-American Ms. Gabbard, 43, who represented Hawaii in the House for eight years as a Democrat, met with the Senators on Monday (December 9, 2024). "I stand in full support and wholeheartedly agree with the statements that President Trump has made over these last few days regarding the developments in Syria," Ms. Gabbard, told reporters at Capitol Hill where she met top U.S. Senators on her nomination.

title: Trump selects farmers agitation supporter Harmeet K. Dhillon as Assistant Attorney General for civil rights
subtitle: Ms. Dhillon is the fourth Indian-origin to be nominated in the Trump 2.0 Cabinet
author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
content: Trump selects farmers agitation supporter Harmeet K. Dhillon as Assistant Attorney General for civil rights Ms. Dhillon is the fourth Indian-origin to be nominated in the Trump 2.0 Cabinet The incoming Donald Trump administration has appointed Harmeet K. Dhillon as the Assistant Attorney General for civil rights. The appointment acquires importance from the Indian point of view as the Biden administration had accused India of planning to assassinate, pro-Khalistan activist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, a U.S. citizen, on American soil. Ms. Dhillon has been vocal about human rights and acquired prominence during the 2020-’21 farmers protest when she criticised the police crackdown against the protesting farmers in Singhu and Ghazipur borders near Delhi.

title: Suspect Luigi Mangione arrested, charged with murder by New York prosecutors in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson
