author: Miscellaneous
content: Elton John says he has lost his eyesight and struggles to see his new stage musical John had disclosed in September that an infection had left him “with only limited vision in one eye” Elton John says he struggled to watch his new musical because he has lost his eyesight after contracting an infection. The singer-songwriter attended the opening night of The Devil Wears Pradain London on Sunday and told the audience that “I haven’t been able to come to many of the previews because, as you know, I have lost my eyesight.”

title: ‘Pushpa 2: The Rule’ dominates advance bookings, earns Rs 50 crore globally
subtitle: Analysts anticipate the film could surpass the records set by blockbusters like ‘Jawan’ and ‘KGF: Chapter 2’
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Pushpa 2: The Rule’ dominates advance bookings, earns Rs 50 crore globally Analysts anticipate the film could surpass the records set by blockbusters like ‘Jawan’ and ‘KGF: Chapter 2’ The much-anticipated sequel Pushpa 2: The Rule is creating waves even before its release, with advance bookings smashing records across the globe. Starring Allu Arjun and directed by Sukumar, the film has already garnered over Rs 50 crore in advance ticket sales, with projections indicating even higher numbers before its December 5 release. Over 1 million tickets have been sold globally, with the Telugu version leading the charts, contributing Rs 17.16 crore to pre-sales. The Hindi version follows closely with Rs 12 crore, while the Tamil and Malayalam versions have added Rs 82.4 lakh and Rs 1.02 crore, respectively. In India alone, the movie has amassed Rs 35.7 crore (nett) in pre-sales, with more screens expected to open soon.

title: Payal Kapadia’s ‘All We Imagine as Light’ wins Best International Feature at Gotham Awards 2024
subtitle: The Gotham Awards celebrated excellence across independent cinema, with ‘A Different Man’ winning Best Feature, and Colman Domingo taking home Outstanding Lead Performance for ‘Sing Sing’
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Payal Kapadia’s ‘All We Imagine as Light’ wins Best International Feature at Gotham Awards 2024 The Gotham Awards celebrated excellence across independent cinema, with ‘A Different Man’ winning Best Feature, and Colman Domingo taking home Outstanding Lead Performance for ‘Sing Sing’ Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia’s All We Imagine as Light triumphed at the 2024 Gotham Awards, earning the Best International Feature award during the ceremony held on Monday night at Cipriani Wall Street, New York City. The film, a Malayalam-Hindi drama, stood out in a competitive category featuring Green Border, Hard Truths, Inside the Yellow Cocoon Shell, and Vermiglio. Accepting the award, Kapadia expressed her excitement, stating, “It’s our first fiction narrative feature film, so it is super nice to get this.” The victory is particularly significant as the film was not chosen as India’s official entry for the Best International Feature Film category at the upcoming Oscars, a spot occupied by Kiran Rao’s Laapataa Ladies.

title: Rishab Shetty to play Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in biopic
subtitle: Directed by Sandeep Singh, ‘Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj’, starring Rishab Shetty in the titular role, will hit the screens in 2027
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Rishab Shetty to play Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in biopic Directed by Sandeep Singh, ‘Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj’, starring Rishab Shetty in the titular role, will hit the screens in 2027 Actor-filmmaker Rishab Shetty will star as Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the biopic of the Maratha warrior. Rishab announced the project with the first-look poster of the movie. To be directed by Sandeep Singh, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj will hit the screens on January 21, 2027. The first-look poster shows Rishab as the 17th century emperor.

title: K-Drama actor Park Min Jae dies at 32 from cardiac arrest
subtitle: A wake in Park’s memory is being held at Seoul National University Hospital Funeral Hall, with his funeral scheduled for December 4
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: K-Drama actor Park Min Jae dies at 32 from cardiac arrest A wake in Park’s memory is being held at Seoul National University Hospital Funeral Hall, with his funeral scheduled for December 4 South Korean actor Park Min Jae has tragically passed away at the age of 32. According to his agency, Big Title, the rising star succumbed to cardiac arrest on November 29 while in China. The news of his untimely demise was shared publicly on December 2, leaving fans and the entertainment industry in shock. “Park Min Jae, a talented actor who loved acting and always gave his best, has departed for heaven,” Big Title announced on social media. “Although we can no longer see him perform, we will proudly remember him as an actor of Big Title. May he rest in peace.”

title: ‘Soodhu Kavvum 2’ trailer: Mirchi Shiva seeks revenge for Shalu’s death in this crime comedy
subtitle: Directed by SJ Arjun, the sequel releases in theatres on December 13
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Soodhu Kavvum 2’ trailer: Mirchi Shiva seeks revenge for Shalu’s death in this crime comedy Directed by SJ Arjun, the sequel releases in theatres on December 13 The trailer of Soodhu Kavvum 2, the upcoming sequel to Nalan Kumaraswamy’s hit 2013 film Soodhu Kavvum, was released by the makers today. The film, directed by SJ Arjun, features actor Mirchi Siva in the lead along with a host of actors that includes fresh faces and actors from the first film. In an interesting turn of events, the trailer begins with a news relay on the kidnapping of Arumai Pragasam (Karunakaran), who is now the Finance Minister of Tamil Nadu. While a political storm brews, we realise that this is the handiwork of Shiva’s character. In a truly unexpected reveal, the trailer also shows Shiva’s character as someone who could see Shalu, Das’ (Vijay Sethupathi) imaginary girlfriend in the first film, and that he has taken over Das as a ‘kenaper’ to seek revenge for Shalu’s death.

title: ‘Kagurabachi’ set for highly anticipated anime adaptation
subtitle: The anime adaptation, produced by Shochiku and CyberAgent, will be animated by Cygames Pictures, the studio behind critically acclaimed titles like ‘Uma Musume’ and ‘Brave Bang Bravern!’
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Kagurabachi’ set for highly anticipated anime adaptation The anime adaptation, produced by Shochiku and CyberAgent, will be animated by Cygames Pictures, the studio behind critically acclaimed titles like ‘Uma Musume’ and ‘Brave Bang Bravern!’ Shonen Jump’s latest smash-hit Kagurabachi is set to make the leap to anime, as revealed in a major report from Toyokeizai. The series, created by Takeru Hokazon, has quickly earned a reputation as the “next-generation” sensation, following in the footsteps of Jujutsu Kaisen and My Hero Academia. The anime adaptation, produced by Shochiku and CyberAgent, will be animated by Cygames Pictures, the studio behind critically acclaimed titles like Uma Musume and Brave Bang Bravern!. Although no release date or streaming details have been confirmed, the decision to partner with Cygames rather than larger, more established studios like MAPPA or Bones has raised eyebrows.

title: Harvey Weinstein hospitalised after 'alarming blood test', attorney says
subtitle: The former film producer had earlier filed a legal claim alleging substandard medical care at New York City's notorious jail complex
author: Miscellaneous
content: Harvey Weinstein hospitalised after 'alarming blood test', attorney says The former film producer had earlier filed a legal claim alleging substandard medical care at New York City's notorious jail complex Harvey Weinstein was hospitalised Monday (December 2, 2024) following an “alarming blood test,” his attorney said, less than a week after the disgraced movie mogul filed a legal claim alleging substandard medical care at New York City's notorious jail complex. Weinstein, 72, was sent to Bellevue Hospital in Manhattan for an “emergent treatment due to an alarming blood test result that requires immediate medical attention,” his attorney, Imran Ansari, said in a statement.

title: ‘UI’ trailer: Upendra predicts an alarming future
subtitle: Kannada actor-director Upendra returns to direction with his magnum opus ‘UI’ after ‘Uppi 2’, which released in 2015
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘UI’ trailer: Upendra predicts an alarming future Kannada actor-director Upendra returns to direction with his magnum opus ‘UI’ after ‘Uppi 2’, which released in 2015 The trailer for the upcoming Pan-Indian film, UI, starring Upendra, was released by the makers on December 02, 2024. Upendra is also the director of the highly-anticipated movie. Originally made in Kannada, the movie will also release in Telugu, Tamil, Hindi and Malayalam on December 20, 2024. The film is co-produced by KP Sreekanth and G Manoharan under the banners Venus Entertainment and Lahari Films LLP respectively.

title: Filmmaker Vignesh Shivan deletes ‘X’ account amid Nayanthara-Dhanush feud
subtitle: Tamil filmmaker Vignesh Shivan has deactivated his ‘X’ account amid copyright dispute between wife and actor Nayanthara and actor-director Dhanush
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Filmmaker Vignesh Shivan deletes ‘X’ account amid Nayanthara-Dhanush feud Tamil filmmaker Vignesh Shivan has deactivated his ‘X’ account amid copyright dispute between wife and actor Nayanthara and actor-director Dhanush Tamil filmmaker Vignesh Shivan has deactivated his X account. Vignesh Shivan was recently in the news for his legal battle with actor Dhanush, who had sued the director and his wife and actor Nayanthara over a copyright dispute. Vignesh Shivan was also trolled on social media for being part of a 2024 pan-India roundtable for a YouTube channel. People questioned his presence in the panel as the filmmaker’s last project was Kaathuvaakula Rendu Kaadhal, which released in 2022.

title: ’Moana 2’ sails to a record $221 million opening as Hollywood celebrates a moviegoing feast
subtitle: ‘Moana 2’ brought in a tidal wave of moviegoers over the Thanksgiving Day weekend, which, combined with ‘Wicked’ and ‘Gladiator II,’ made for an unprecedented weekend in cinemas and a confluence of blockbusters more like what’s often found in late December
author: Miscellaneous
content: ’Moana 2’ sails to a record $221 million opening as Hollywood celebrates a moviegoing feast ‘Moana 2’ brought in a tidal wave of moviegoers over the Thanksgiving Day weekend, which, combined with ‘Wicked’ and ‘Gladiator II,’ made for an unprecedented weekend in cinemas and a confluence of blockbusters more like what’s often found in late December Christmas came early at the box office this year. Moana 2 brought in a tidal wave of moviegoers over the Thanksgiving Day weekend, setting records with $221 million in ticket sales, according to studio estimates Sunday. That, combined with Wicked and Gladiator II, made for an unprecedented weekend in cinemas and a confluence of blockbusters more like what’s often found in late December.

title: Ghantasala biopic announces its release date
subtitle: Unveiling the release date poster of ‘Ghantasala the Great’, the biopic on Ghantasala Venkateswara Rao, former Vice President Venkaiah Naidu lauded the legendary singer’s contribution to music
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Ghantasala biopic announces its release date Unveiling the release date poster of ‘Ghantasala the Great’, the biopic on Ghantasala Venkateswara Rao, former Vice President Venkaiah Naidu lauded the legendary singer’s contribution to music The Telugu film Ghantasala the Great, a biopic on the life of singer Ghantasala Venkateswara Rao, has announced its release date. At an event held in Hyderabad recently, the makers of the film starring singer Krishna Chaitanya in the titular role, announced that the film will release in theatres on February 14, 2025. Krishna Chaitanya’s wife Mridula will portray Ghantasala’s wife Savitri in the film written and directed by Ch Rama Rao. The release date poster was unveiled by former Vice President Venkaiah Naidu who asserted the relevance of the film narrating the story of the legendary singer. “Society needs to know about the life of Ghantasala, the Telugu freedom fighter, singer and music director. Ghantasala is referred to as Shatabdi Gayakudu (singer of the century). I call him an immortal singer. When he sang hymns from the Bhagavad Gita, people would listen with devotion. As long as there is music, he will be in people’s minds.”

title: Actor Vikrant Massey announces retirement: It’s time to go home, says ‘12th Fail’ star
subtitle: Actor Vikrant Massey, who starred in films such as ‘12th Fail’, ‘Haseen Dillruba’ and ‘The Sabarmati Report’, has said that he will quit the film industry in 2025
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Actor Vikrant Massey announces retirement: It’s time to go home, says ‘12th Fail’ star Actor Vikrant Massey, who starred in films such as ‘12th Fail’, ‘Haseen Dillruba’ and ‘The Sabarmati Report’, has said that he will quit the film industry in 2025 Actor Vikrant Massey, known for films such as 12th Fail, Haseen Dillruba and The Sabarmati Report, has announced retirement. In an Instagram post, Massey has said that 2025 will be his last year in the film industry. “The last few years and beyond have been phenomenal. I thank each and everyone of you for your indelible support,” the actor wrote. “But as I move forward, I realise it’s time to recalibrate and go back home, as a husband, father, a son and also as an actor.”

title: ‘Rudhiram,’ starring Raj B Shetty and Aparna Balamurali, gets a release date
subtitle: Billed as an ‘intense survival thriller,’ the film is directed by Jisho Lon Antony
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Rudhiram,’ starring Raj B Shetty and Aparna Balamurali, gets a release date Billed as an ‘intense survival thriller,’ the film is directed by Jisho Lon Antony Rudhiram, the upcoming Malayalam film starring Kannada star Raj B Shetty and Aparna Balamurali, is all set to release in theatres on December 13, the makers confirmed on Saturday (November 20) Billed as an ‘intense survival thriller,’ Rudhiram is directed by Jisho Lon Antony.

title: Kuchipudi dancer Veenah Rao to debut in director YVS Chowdhary’s Telugu film
subtitle: YVS Chowdhary unveiled a showreel of Veenah Rao, who will debut in his new film starring Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Kuchipudi dancer Veenah Rao to debut in director YVS Chowdhary’s Telugu film YVS Chowdhary unveiled a showreel of Veenah Rao, who will debut in his new film starring Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao Director YVS Chowdhary, who had announced his new Telugu film in which he will be launching the fourth generation actor from the NTR family, the great grandson of legendary actor Nandamuri Taraka Rama Rao, also named after him, recently announced the film’s female lead. Kuchipudi dancer Veenah Rao will make her debut as leading lady opposite NTR. Veenah was introduced at a media gathering in Hyderabad in the presence of producers Supriya Yarlagadda and Swapna Dutt, who graced the event.

title: Kolkata hosts India’s oldest queer film festival; films from across the country and world feature at two-day fest
subtitle: Over 14 films featured at the event, where filmmakers shared their personal journeys through their films on queer lives and spaces
author: Shrabana Chatterjee
content: Kolkata hosts India’s oldest queer film festival; films from across the country and world feature at two-day fest Over 14 films featured at the event, where filmmakers shared their personal journeys through their films on queer lives and spaces India’s oldest queer film festival, the Calcutta International LGBTQIA+ Film and Video Festival — also known as “Dialogues” — commenced in Kolkata on Saturday (November 30, 2024). Several celebrated films from countries like Turkey, Pakistan, Germany and many more are being screened at the festival. Many filmmakers from across India are also participating in the festival with their art pieces. Multiple filmmakers,  presenting their films, documentaries, opened up about their personal experiences and the queer community’s experiences through their work. The festival was inaugurated amidst emotional slogans of “Azaadi [freedom]” asking for queer rights and freedom for all members of the community. The Basusree Cinema Hall in south Kolkata echoed through the chorus of the slogans as the hall filled up.

title: Modi attends special screening of ‘The Sabarmati Report’
subtitle: Mr. Modi’s Cabinet colleagues attended the screening; the film’s actors Vikrant Massey and Raashi Khanna were also present
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Modi attends special screening of ‘The Sabarmati Report’ Mr. Modi’s Cabinet colleagues attended the screening; the film’s actors Vikrant Massey and Raashi Khanna were also present Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday (December 2, 2024) watched The Sabarmati Report, produced by filmmaker Ektaa Kapoor, said to be based on the burning of the Sabarmati Express in which 59 people, including 27 women and 10 children returning from a ceremony in Ayodhya, were killed in Gujarat’s Godhra on February 27, 2002. The film, starring Vikrant Massey, Raashi Khanna, and Ridhi Dogra, was screened at the Balayogi Auditorium of the Parliament Library building.

title: Anaswara Rajan, Sajin Gopu’s next titled ‘Painkili’; first look out
subtitle: The film is written by ‘Aavesham’ maker Jithu Madhavan and directed by Sreejith Babu
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Anaswara Rajan, Sajin Gopu’s next titled ‘Painkili’; first look out The film is written by ‘Aavesham’ maker Jithu Madhavan and directed by Sreejith Babu We had previously reported that actors Anaswara Rajan and Sajin Gopu are teaming up for a Malayalam film written by Aavesham-maker Jithu Madhavan and directed by Sreejith Babu. On Sunday (December 1), the makers of the film announced that the film’s been titled Painkili. The makes unveiled a special first look poster of the film to announce the title. The poster features Sajiin floating mid-air to much awe of his family members. Anaswara can be seen blowing bubbles.

title: Basil Joseph’s ‘Ponman’ to release on this date
subtitle: ‘Ponman’ is an official adaptation of the 2020 novel ‘Nalanchu Cheruppakar’ by GR Indugopan
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Basil Joseph’s ‘Ponman’ to release on this date ‘Ponman’ is an official adaptation of the 2020 novel ‘Nalanchu Cheruppakar’ by GR Indugopan Ponman, actor-director Basil Joseph’s upcoming film with production designer-turned-filmmaker Jothish Shankar, is all set to release in theatres on February 6, 2025, the makers announced on Saturday (November 30). Basil shared a new poster of the film to announce the news.

title: Alfonso Cuaron says he almost directed a James Bond film
subtitle: The filmmaker said he eventually passed over the project after a dinner with fellow filmmaker Joel Coen
author: Miscellaneous
content: Alfonso Cuaron says he almost directed a James Bond film The filmmaker said he eventually passed over the project after a dinner with fellow filmmaker Joel Coen Oscar winner Alfonso Cuaron says he was once offered to direct a James Bond film, but he decided to turn it down as he was "troubled about the idea of doing it". While Cuaron didn't reveal which Bond film he was supposed to direct, he said he eventually passed over the project after a dinner with fellow filmmaker Joel Coen.

title: Marshall Brickman, who co-wrote ’Annie Hall’ with Woody Allen, dies at 85
subtitle: Brickman co-wrote ‘Sleeper’ (1973), ‘Annie Hall’ (1977), ‘Manhattan’ (1979), and ‘Manhattan Murder Mystery’(1993) with Allen
author: Miscellaneous
content: Marshall Brickman, who co-wrote ’Annie Hall’ with Woody Allen, dies at 85 Brickman co-wrote ‘Sleeper’ (1973), ‘Annie Hall’ (1977), ‘Manhattan’ (1979), and ‘Manhattan Murder Mystery’(1993) with Allen Marshall Brickman, the Oscar-winning screenwriter, whose wide-ranging career spanned some of Woody Allen’s best films, the Broadway musical Jersey Boys, and a number of Johnny Carson’s most beloved sketches, has died. He was 85. Brickman died Friday in Manhattan, his daughter Sophie Brickman told The New York Times. No cause of death was cited.

title: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt
subtitle: White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards Emmy-winning actor Jeremy Allen White is stepping into the Star Wars universe, lending his voice to Rotta the Hutt, Jabba the Hutt’s son, in the upcoming film The Mandalorian & Grogu. Known for his acclaimed role in FX’s The Bear, this marks White’s first foray into a major franchise. Set to debut on May 22, 2026, The Mandalorian & Grogu promises to expand the universe of Disney+’s hit series The Mandalorian. The show takes place after the events of Return of the Jedi, where Jabba’s death left Tatooine’s criminal underworld in chaos. While plot details remain closely guarded, White’s role as Rotta hints at new dynamics in the power struggles on the desert planet. Speculation is mounting about possible appearances from Boba Fett (Temuera Morrison) and his ally Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen), who previously claimed Jabba’s throne in The Book of Boba Fett.

title: ‘Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous’ trailer: Netflix’s docu offers glimpse into the life of India’s most famous rapper
subtitle: Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous’ trailer: Netflix’s docu offers glimpse into the life of India’s most famous rapper Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20 Streaming giant Netflix on Tuesday unveiled the trailer for its upcoming documentary film, Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous, which chronicles the journey of the titular iconic music sensation. Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20. In the trailer, we see how a boy from a humble Punjabi background went on to become one of the most popular Indian rappers, taking Punjabi music to the global stage. With the help of personal accounts from friends, family, colleagues and collaborators (including one Salman Khan), the documentary peels back the layers of Honey Singh’s life to reveal the man behind the angrezi beats and controversies.

title: James Gunn to shoot ‘pickup shots’ for ‘Superman’, clarifies there are ‘no reshoots’
subtitle: ‘Superman’, starring David Corenswet in the titled role, is set for release on July 11, 2025
author: Miscellaneous
content: James Gunn to shoot ‘pickup shots’ for ‘Superman’, clarifies there are ‘no reshoots’ ‘Superman’, starring David Corenswet in the titled role, is set for release on July 11, 2025 Director and producer James Gunn has shared a clarification on the reports that his film Superman would undergo reshoots and confirmed that he will only film a few "pickup shots," according to Deadline. Taking to his social media platform, he informed his fans about the additional filming of the superhero film. "Sort of. Not a few days. We're doing a day and a half of pickup shots. No scenes. No reshoots. Just a handful of individual shots to enhance the film," Gunn shared on Threads.

title: Yash Raj Films, Posham Pa Pictures team up to produce theatrical films
subtitle: Yash Raj Films and Posham Pa Pictures will jointly produce theatrical releases starting 2025
author: Miscellaneous
content: Yash Raj Films, Posham Pa Pictures team up to produce theatrical films Yash Raj Films and Posham Pa Pictures will jointly produce theatrical releases starting 2025 Production houses Yash Raj Films (YRF) and Posham Pa Pictures on Tuesday announced a creative partnership under which they will produce theatrical films starting next year. YRF, one of the top banners of the country, has backed several diverse films including Kabhi Kabhie, Deewar, Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, Veer-Zaara, Ek Tha Tiger, and the Dhoom franchise. Posham Pa Pictures has garnered acclaim for Kaala Paani, Mamla Legal Hai, Home Shanti and Jaadugar.

title: Akshay Kumar starts shooting for ‘Bhooth Bangla’, film to release in April 2026
subtitle: ‘Bhooth Bangla’ reunites Akshay and Priyadarshan after 14 years
author: Miscellaneous
content: Akshay Kumar starts shooting for ‘Bhooth Bangla’, film to release in April 2026 ‘Bhooth Bangla’ reunites Akshay and Priyadarshan after 14 years Bollywood superstar Akshay Kumar on Tuesday announced thatBhooth Bangla, his upcoming horror comedy with frequent collaborator Priyadarshan, will hit the theatres on April 2, 2026. The actor, who has worked with the veteran filmmaker on several hit comedies such as Hera Pheri, Garam Masala, Bhool Bhulaiyaa, and Bhagam Bhag, also said he has commenced filming on the movie.

title: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees
subtitle: Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods Jacques Audiard’s musical “Emilia Pérez,” about a Mexican drug lord who undergoes gender-affirming surgery, led nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes on Monday (December 9, 2024), scoring 10 nods to lead it over other contenders like the musical smash “Wicked,” the papal thriller “Conclave” and the postwar epic “The Brutalist.” Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia and her debut feature “All We Imagine As Light” have secured two nominations. The nominations are in the categories of Best Motion Picture - Non-English Language and Best Director - Motion Picture for Kapadia.

title: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet
subtitle: Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine
author: Srinivasa Ramanujam
content: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine Vijay Ashokan hated learning the Thirukural as a child. “We would have to memorise it and it was very difficult. Even if we made a small mistake while reciting or writing it, we would be chided.” Learning the ancient Tamil text by rote irked Vijay as a child. “I developed an aversion towards the text and its author, Thiruvalluvar,” he recalls. Luckily, after schooling, he chanced upon a translated version of the book that changed his perspective. “I realised how great he was and understood the depth of his work.”

title: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards
subtitle: Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town
author: Miscellaneous
content: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's debut film production Girls Will Be Girls has earned two nominations — the John Cassavetes Award and Best Supporting Performance for Kani Kusruti — at the 40th Independent Spirit Awards. Girls Will Be Girls, directed by Shuchi Talati, revolves around a 16-year-old girl called Mira (Preeti Panigrahi) whose rebellious awakening is intertwined with her mother's (Kusruti) unfulfilled coming-of-age experiences. According to a press release, the film is one of the five contenders for the John Cassavetes Award, which honours the creative team of the best films made with a budget under USD 1 million.

title: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’
subtitle: The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’ The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to welcome back two of its most iconic stars, Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr., in the upcoming Avengers: Doomsday. Scheduled for release on May 1, 2026, the film will see Downey Jr. take on the role of Doctor Doom, while Evans’ return as Steve Rogers raises questions about the multiverse’s influence on the MCU. Directed by the Russo Brothers, who previously helmed Captain America: Civil War, Avengers: Infinity War, and Avengers: Endgame, the film is expected to build on the sprawling narrative introduced in Endgame. Downey Jr.’s portrayal of a Tony Stark variant and Evans’ rumored return as a version of Steve Rogers are set to challenge fans’ expectations. While Anthony Mackie’s Sam Wilson remains the official Captain America, speculation swirls about how Evans’ character will fit into the story.

title: Asif Ali, Anaswara Rajan’s ‘Rekhachithram’ gets a release date
subtitle: ‘Rekhachithram,’ which went on floors on May 3, also features Manoj K Jayan in a pivotal role
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Asif Ali, Anaswara Rajan’s ‘Rekhachithram’ gets a release date ‘Rekhachithram,’ which went on floors on May 3, also features Manoj K Jayan in a pivotal role We had previously reported that actors Asif Ali and Anaswara Rajan are teaming up for a Malayalam film directed by Jofin T Chacko. Now, the latest is that the film, titled Rekhachithram, will release in theatres on January 6. Asif announced the news on his social media handles with a poster that features him as a cop, and Anaswara as a nun.

title: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’
subtitle: ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’ ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt Punjabi star Sonam Bajwa is the latest actor to join the cast of Baaghi 4, fronted by Tiger Shroff. The upcoming project is the fourth installment in the Baaghi franchise and is slated to hit the big screens on September 5, 2025. Directed by A Harsha, the film is produced by Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment. Shroff shared an Instagram Story announcing her addition to the cast.

title: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films
subtitle: In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel
author: Bhuvanesh Chandar
content: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel A two-film-strong, 340-minute-long cat-and-mouse game comes to an end in director Sukumar’s Pushpa 2: The Rule. A climactic scene ambiguously ends the arc, urging audiences to ready themselves to leave, only to be compelled back to their seats for 40 more minutes. The extended climax of the Allu Arjun-starrer, meant as a segue to a third Pushpa film, is an excruciatingly tedious episode that leaves you with a poor aftertaste — it’s a cold shower moment in this otherwise ‘wildfire’ of a film. This is a new fad picked up by commercial filmmakers of the pan-India movement — franchising, for better monetisation or to secure a working formula for the future. Most big-ticket films these days either end with a cliffhanger, depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product, or add a surprise climactic cameo to end on a high note and make way for a sequel. Suriya’s Kanguvawas undoubtedly an untested attempt in Tamil, but the makers were quick to jump on this bandwagon, with a surprise cameo by Karthi and a hook to keep us waiting for the second part. With the disastrous reception at the box office, would a Kanguva sequel materialise?

title: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert
subtitle: The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore Amid calls for boycotting his concert, popular singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert to Urdu poet Rahat Indori in Inodre, Madhya Pradesh. The Punjabi singing sensation mentioned Indori’s lines from his ghazal. “Kisi ke baap ka Hindustan thodi hai,” ( India isn’t anyone’s property) he said during the show. The singer didn’t make a direct reference to the Bajrang Dal, who protested against his concert in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore, with some Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislators voicing their support for the demands. Hundreds of people affiliated to the Hindu outfits, carrying sticks and banners, staged a protest at the Collectorate on Sunday morning.

title: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt
subtitle: White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards Emmy-winning actor Jeremy Allen White is stepping into the Star Wars universe, lending his voice to Rotta the Hutt, Jabba the Hutt’s son, in the upcoming film The Mandalorian & Grogu. Known for his acclaimed role in FX’s The Bear, this marks White’s first foray into a major franchise. Set to debut on May 22, 2026, The Mandalorian & Grogu promises to expand the universe of Disney+’s hit series The Mandalorian. The show takes place after the events of Return of the Jedi, where Jabba’s death left Tatooine’s criminal underworld in chaos. While plot details remain closely guarded, White’s role as Rotta hints at new dynamics in the power struggles on the desert planet. Speculation is mounting about possible appearances from Boba Fett (Temuera Morrison) and his ally Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen), who previously claimed Jabba’s throne in The Book of Boba Fett.

title: ‘Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous’ trailer: Netflix’s docu offers glimpse into the life of India’s most famous rapper
subtitle: Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous’ trailer: Netflix’s docu offers glimpse into the life of India’s most famous rapper Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20 Streaming giant Netflix on Tuesday unveiled the trailer for its upcoming documentary film, Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous, which chronicles the journey of the titular iconic music sensation. Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20. In the trailer, we see how a boy from a humble Punjabi background went on to become one of the most popular Indian rappers, taking Punjabi music to the global stage. With the help of personal accounts from friends, family, colleagues and collaborators (including one Salman Khan), the documentary peels back the layers of Honey Singh’s life to reveal the man behind the angrezi beats and controversies.

title: James Gunn to shoot ‘pickup shots’ for ‘Superman’, clarifies there are ‘no reshoots’
subtitle: ‘Superman’, starring David Corenswet in the titled role, is set for release on July 11, 2025
author: Miscellaneous
content: James Gunn to shoot ‘pickup shots’ for ‘Superman’, clarifies there are ‘no reshoots’ ‘Superman’, starring David Corenswet in the titled role, is set for release on July 11, 2025 Director and producer James Gunn has shared a clarification on the reports that his film Superman would undergo reshoots and confirmed that he will only film a few "pickup shots," according to Deadline. Taking to his social media platform, he informed his fans about the additional filming of the superhero film. "Sort of. Not a few days. We're doing a day and a half of pickup shots. No scenes. No reshoots. Just a handful of individual shots to enhance the film," Gunn shared on Threads.

title: Yash Raj Films, Posham Pa Pictures team up to produce theatrical films
subtitle: Yash Raj Films and Posham Pa Pictures will jointly produce theatrical releases starting 2025
author: Miscellaneous
content: Yash Raj Films, Posham Pa Pictures team up to produce theatrical films Yash Raj Films and Posham Pa Pictures will jointly produce theatrical releases starting 2025 Production houses Yash Raj Films (YRF) and Posham Pa Pictures on Tuesday announced a creative partnership under which they will produce theatrical films starting next year. YRF, one of the top banners of the country, has backed several diverse films including Kabhi Kabhie, Deewar, Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, Veer-Zaara, Ek Tha Tiger, and the Dhoom franchise. Posham Pa Pictures has garnered acclaim for Kaala Paani, Mamla Legal Hai, Home Shanti and Jaadugar.

title: Akshay Kumar starts shooting for ‘Bhooth Bangla’, film to release in April 2026
subtitle: ‘Bhooth Bangla’ reunites Akshay and Priyadarshan after 14 years
author: Miscellaneous
content: Akshay Kumar starts shooting for ‘Bhooth Bangla’, film to release in April 2026 ‘Bhooth Bangla’ reunites Akshay and Priyadarshan after 14 years Bollywood superstar Akshay Kumar on Tuesday announced thatBhooth Bangla, his upcoming horror comedy with frequent collaborator Priyadarshan, will hit the theatres on April 2, 2026. The actor, who has worked with the veteran filmmaker on several hit comedies such as Hera Pheri, Garam Masala, Bhool Bhulaiyaa, and Bhagam Bhag, also said he has commenced filming on the movie.

title: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees
subtitle: Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods Jacques Audiard’s musical “Emilia Pérez,” about a Mexican drug lord who undergoes gender-affirming surgery, led nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes on Monday (December 9, 2024), scoring 10 nods to lead it over other contenders like the musical smash “Wicked,” the papal thriller “Conclave” and the postwar epic “The Brutalist.” Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia and her debut feature “All We Imagine As Light” have secured two nominations. The nominations are in the categories of Best Motion Picture - Non-English Language and Best Director - Motion Picture for Kapadia.

title: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet
subtitle: Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine
author: Srinivasa Ramanujam
content: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine Vijay Ashokan hated learning the Thirukural as a child. “We would have to memorise it and it was very difficult. Even if we made a small mistake while reciting or writing it, we would be chided.” Learning the ancient Tamil text by rote irked Vijay as a child. “I developed an aversion towards the text and its author, Thiruvalluvar,” he recalls. Luckily, after schooling, he chanced upon a translated version of the book that changed his perspective. “I realised how great he was and understood the depth of his work.”

title: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards
subtitle: Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town
author: Miscellaneous
content: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's debut film production Girls Will Be Girls has earned two nominations — the John Cassavetes Award and Best Supporting Performance for Kani Kusruti — at the 40th Independent Spirit Awards. Girls Will Be Girls, directed by Shuchi Talati, revolves around a 16-year-old girl called Mira (Preeti Panigrahi) whose rebellious awakening is intertwined with her mother's (Kusruti) unfulfilled coming-of-age experiences. According to a press release, the film is one of the five contenders for the John Cassavetes Award, which honours the creative team of the best films made with a budget under USD 1 million.

title: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’
subtitle: The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’ The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to welcome back two of its most iconic stars, Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr., in the upcoming Avengers: Doomsday. Scheduled for release on May 1, 2026, the film will see Downey Jr. take on the role of Doctor Doom, while Evans’ return as Steve Rogers raises questions about the multiverse’s influence on the MCU. Directed by the Russo Brothers, who previously helmed Captain America: Civil War, Avengers: Infinity War, and Avengers: Endgame, the film is expected to build on the sprawling narrative introduced in Endgame. Downey Jr.’s portrayal of a Tony Stark variant and Evans’ rumored return as a version of Steve Rogers are set to challenge fans’ expectations. While Anthony Mackie’s Sam Wilson remains the official Captain America, speculation swirls about how Evans’ character will fit into the story.

title: Asif Ali, Anaswara Rajan’s ‘Rekhachithram’ gets a release date
subtitle: ‘Rekhachithram,’ which went on floors on May 3, also features Manoj K Jayan in a pivotal role
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Asif Ali, Anaswara Rajan’s ‘Rekhachithram’ gets a release date ‘Rekhachithram,’ which went on floors on May 3, also features Manoj K Jayan in a pivotal role We had previously reported that actors Asif Ali and Anaswara Rajan are teaming up for a Malayalam film directed by Jofin T Chacko. Now, the latest is that the film, titled Rekhachithram, will release in theatres on January 6. Asif announced the news on his social media handles with a poster that features him as a cop, and Anaswara as a nun.

title: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’
subtitle: ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’ ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt Punjabi star Sonam Bajwa is the latest actor to join the cast of Baaghi 4, fronted by Tiger Shroff. The upcoming project is the fourth installment in the Baaghi franchise and is slated to hit the big screens on September 5, 2025. Directed by A Harsha, the film is produced by Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment. Shroff shared an Instagram Story announcing her addition to the cast.

author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods Jacques Audiard’s musical “Emilia Pérez,” about a Mexican drug lord who undergoes gender-affirming surgery, led nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes on Monday (December 9, 2024), scoring 10 nods to lead it over other contenders like the musical smash “Wicked,” the papal thriller “Conclave” and the postwar epic “The Brutalist.” Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia and her debut feature “All We Imagine As Light” have secured two nominations. title: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet
subtitle: Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine
author: Srinivasa Ramanujam
content: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine Vijay Ashokan hated learning the Thirukural as a child. “We would have to memorise it and it was very difficult. Even if we made a small mistake while reciting or writing it, we would be chided.” Learning the ancient Tamil text by rote irked Vijay as a child. “I developed an aversion towards the text and its author, Thiruvalluvar,” he recalls. Luckily, after schooling, he chanced upon a translated version of the book that changed his perspective. “I realised how great he was and understood the depth of his work.”

title: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards
subtitle: Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town
author: Miscellaneous
content: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's debut film production Girls Will Be Girls has earned two nominations — the John Cassavetes Award and Best Supporting Performance for Kani Kusruti — at the 40th Independent Spirit Awards. Girls Will Be Girls, directed by Shuchi Talati, revolves around a 16-year-old girl called Mira (Preeti Panigrahi) whose rebellious awakening is intertwined with her mother's (Kusruti) unfulfilled coming-of-age experiences. According to a press release, the film is one of the five contenders for the John Cassavetes Award, which honours the creative team of the best films made with a budget under USD 1 million.

title: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’
subtitle: The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’ The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to welcome back two of its most iconic stars, Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr., in the upcoming Avengers: Doomsday. Scheduled for release on May 1, 2026, the film will see Downey Jr. take on the role of Doctor Doom, while Evans’ return as Steve Rogers raises questions about the multiverse’s influence on the MCU. Directed by the Russo Brothers, who previously helmed Captain America: Civil War, Avengers: Infinity War, and Avengers: Endgame, the film is expected to build on the sprawling narrative introduced in Endgame. Downey Jr.’s portrayal of a Tony Stark variant and Evans’ rumored return as a version of Steve Rogers are set to challenge fans’ expectations. While Anthony Mackie’s Sam Wilson remains the official Captain America, speculation swirls about how Evans’ character will fit into the story.

content: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’ ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt Punjabi star Sonam Bajwa is the latest actor to join the cast of Baaghi 4, fronted by Tiger Shroff. title: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films
subtitle: In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel
author: Bhuvanesh Chandar
content: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel A two-film-strong, 340-minute-long cat-and-mouse game comes to an end in director Sukumar’s Pushpa 2: The Rule. A climactic scene ambiguously ends the arc, urging audiences to ready themselves to leave, only to be compelled back to their seats for 40 more minutes. The extended climax of the Allu Arjun-starrer, meant as a segue to a third Pushpa film, is an excruciatingly tedious episode that leaves you with a poor aftertaste — it’s a cold shower moment in this otherwise ‘wildfire’ of a film. This is a new fad picked up by commercial filmmakers of the pan-India movement — franchising, for better monetisation or to secure a working formula for the future. Most big-ticket films these days either end with a cliffhanger, depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product, or add a surprise climactic cameo to end on a high note and make way for a sequel. Suriya’s Kanguvawas undoubtedly an untested attempt in Tamil, but the makers were quick to jump on this bandwagon, with a surprise cameo by Karthi and a hook to keep us waiting for the second part. With the disastrous reception at the box office, would a Kanguva sequel materialise?

title: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert
subtitle: The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore Amid calls for boycotting his concert, popular singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert to Urdu poet Rahat Indori in Inodre, Madhya Pradesh. The Punjabi singing sensation mentioned Indori’s lines from his ghazal. “Kisi ke baap ka Hindustan thodi hai,” ( India isn’t anyone’s property) he said during the show. The singer didn’t make a direct reference to the Bajrang Dal, who protested against his concert in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore, with some Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislators voicing their support for the demands. title: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees
subtitle: Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods Jacques Audiard’s musical “Emilia Pérez,” about a Mexican drug lord who undergoes gender-affirming surgery, led nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes on Monday (December 9, 2024), scoring 10 nods to lead it over other contenders like the musical smash “Wicked,” the papal thriller “Conclave” and the postwar epic “The Brutalist.” Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia and her debut feature “All We Imagine As Light” have secured two nominations. The nominations are in the categories of Best Motion Picture - Non-English Language and Best Director - Motion Picture for Kapadia.

title: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet
subtitle: Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine
author: Srinivasa Ramanujam
content: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine Vijay Ashokan hated learning the Thirukural as a child. “We would have to memorise it and it was very difficult. Even if we made a small mistake while reciting or writing it, we would be chided.” Learning the ancient Tamil text by rote irked Vijay as a child. “I developed an aversion towards the text and its author, Thiruvalluvar,” he recalls. Luckily, after schooling, he chanced upon a translated version of the book that changed his perspective. “I realised how great he was and understood the depth of his work.”

title: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards
subtitle: Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town
author: Miscellaneous
content: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's debut film production Girls Will Be Girls has earned two nominations — the John Cassavetes Award and Best Supporting Performance for Kani Kusruti — at the 40th Independent Spirit Awards. Girls Will Be Girls, directed by Shuchi Talati, revolves around a 16-year-old girl called Mira (Preeti Panigrahi) whose rebellious awakening is intertwined with her mother's (Kusruti) unfulfilled coming-of-age experiences. According to a press release, the film is one of the five contenders for the John Cassavetes Award, which honours the creative team of the best films made with a budget under USD 1 million.

title: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’
subtitle: The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’ The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to welcome back two of its most iconic stars, Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr., in the upcoming Avengers: Doomsday. Scheduled for release on May 1, 2026, the film will see Downey Jr. take on the role of Doctor Doom, while Evans’ return as Steve Rogers raises questions about the multiverse’s influence on the MCU. Directed by the Russo Brothers, who previously helmed Captain America: Civil War, Avengers: Infinity War, and Avengers: Endgame, the film is expected to build on the sprawling narrative introduced in Endgame. Downey Jr.’s portrayal of a Tony Stark variant and Evans’ rumored return as a version of Steve Rogers are set to challenge fans’ expectations. While Anthony Mackie’s Sam Wilson remains the official Captain America, speculation swirls about how Evans’ character will fit into the story.

title: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films
subtitle: In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel
author: Bhuvanesh Chandar
content: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel A two-film-strong, 340-minute-long cat-and-mouse game comes to an end in director Sukumar’s Pushpa 2: The Rule. A climactic scene ambiguously ends the arc, urging audiences to ready themselves to leave, only to be compelled back to their seats for 40 more minutes. The extended climax of the Allu Arjun-starrer, meant as a segue to a third Pushpa film, is an excruciatingly tedious episode that leaves you with a poor aftertaste — it’s a cold shower moment in this otherwise ‘wildfire’ of a film. This is a new fad picked up by commercial filmmakers of the pan-India movement — franchising, for better monetisation or to secure a working formula for the future. Most big-ticket films these days either end with a cliffhanger, depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product, or add a surprise climactic cameo to end on a high note and make way for a sequel. Suriya’s Kanguvawas undoubtedly an untested attempt in Tamil, but the makers were quick to jump on this bandwagon, with a surprise cameo by Karthi and a hook to keep us waiting for the second part. With the disastrous reception at the box office, would a Kanguva sequel materialise?

title: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert
subtitle: The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore Amid calls for boycotting his concert, popular singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert to Urdu poet Rahat Indori in Inodre, Madhya Pradesh. The Punjabi singing sensation mentioned Indori’s lines from his ghazal. “Kisi ke baap ka Hindustan thodi hai,” ( India isn’t anyone’s property) he said during the show. The singer didn’t make a direct reference to the Bajrang Dal, who protested against his concert in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore, with some Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislators voicing their support for the demands. Hundreds of people affiliated to the Hindu outfits, carrying sticks and banners, staged a protest at the Collectorate on Sunday morning.

title: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt
subtitle: White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards Emmy-winning actor Jeremy Allen White is stepping into the Star Wars universe, lending his voice to Rotta the Hutt, Jabba the Hutt’s son, in the upcoming film The Mandalorian & Grogu. Known for his acclaimed role in FX’s The Bear, this marks White’s first foray into a major franchise. Set to debut on May 22, 2026, The Mandalorian & Grogu promises to expand the universe of Disney+’s hit series The Mandalorian. The show takes place after the events of Return of the Jedi, where Jabba’s death left Tatooine’s criminal underworld in chaos. While plot details remain closely guarded, White’s role as Rotta hints at new dynamics in the power struggles on the desert planet. Speculation is mounting about possible appearances from Boba Fett (Temuera Morrison) and his ally Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen), who previously claimed Jabba’s throne in The Book of Boba Fett.

content: Golden Globes 2025: Here’s the full list of nominees Jacques Audiard’s audacious musical “Emilia Pérez” leads nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes, scoring 10 nods Jacques Audiard’s musical “Emilia Pérez,” about a Mexican drug lord who undergoes gender-affirming surgery, led nominations to the 82nd Golden Globes on Monday (December 9, 2024), scoring 10 nods to lead it over other contenders like the musical smash “Wicked,” the papal thriller “Conclave” and the postwar epic “The Brutalist.” Indian filmmaker Payal Kapadia and her debut feature “All We Imagine As Light” have secured two nominations. The nominations are in the categories of Best Motion Picture - Non-English Language and Best Director - Motion Picture for Kapadia.

title: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet
subtitle: Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine
author: Srinivasa Ramanujam
content: Thiruvalluvar on a time machine: Animation series ‘The Grandys’ gives a makeover to the Tamil poet Backed by Chennai-based VA Studios, ‘The Grandys’ features Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar taking a time machine Vijay Ashokan hated learning the Thirukural as a child. “We would have to memorise it and it was very difficult. Even if we made a small mistake while reciting or writing it, we would be chided.” Learning the ancient Tamil text by rote irked Vijay as a child. “I developed an aversion towards the text and its author, Thiruvalluvar,” he recalls. Luckily, after schooling, he chanced upon a translated version of the book that changed his perspective. “I realised how great he was and understood the depth of his work.”

title: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards
subtitle: Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town
author: Miscellaneous
content: Richa Chadha-Ali Fazal’s ‘Girls Will Be Girls’ earns two nominations at Independent Spirit Awards Kani Kusruti and Preeti Panigrahi star as mother and daughter in this coming-of-age story set around a boarding school in a Himalayan hill town Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal's debut film production Girls Will Be Girls has earned two nominations — the John Cassavetes Award and Best Supporting Performance for Kani Kusruti — at the 40th Independent Spirit Awards. Girls Will Be Girls, directed by Shuchi Talati, revolves around a 16-year-old girl called Mira (Preeti Panigrahi) whose rebellious awakening is intertwined with her mother's (Kusruti) unfulfilled coming-of-age experiences. According to a press release, the film is one of the five contenders for the John Cassavetes Award, which honours the creative team of the best films made with a budget under USD 1 million.

title: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’
subtitle: The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr. to make MCU reunion in ‘Avengers: Doomsday’ The film will also feature the MCU’s newly cast ‘Fantastic Four’, including Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby The Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to welcome back two of its most iconic stars, Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr., in the upcoming Avengers: Doomsday. Scheduled for release on May 1, 2026, the film will see Downey Jr. take on the role of Doctor Doom, while Evans’ return as Steve Rogers raises questions about the multiverse’s influence on the MCU. Directed by the Russo Brothers, who previously helmed Captain America: Civil War, Avengers: Infinity War, and Avengers: Endgame, the film is expected to build on the sprawling narrative introduced in Endgame. Downey Jr.’s portrayal of a Tony Stark variant and Evans’ rumored return as a version of Steve Rogers are set to challenge fans’ expectations. While Anthony Mackie’s Sam Wilson remains the official Captain America, speculation swirls about how Evans’ character will fit into the story.

subtitle: ‘Rekhachithram,’ which went on floors on May 3, also features Manoj K Jayan in a pivotal role
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Asif Ali, Anaswara Rajan’s ‘Rekhachithram’ gets a release date ‘Rekhachithram,’ which went on floors on May 3, also features Manoj K Jayan in a pivotal role We had previously reported that actors Asif Ali and Anaswara Rajan are teaming up for a Malayalam film directed by Jofin T Chacko. Now, the latest is that the film, titled Rekhachithram, will release in theatres on January 6. Asif announced the news on his social media handles with a poster that features him as a cop, and Anaswara as a nun.

title: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’
subtitle: ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt
author: Miscellaneous
content: Sonam Bajwa joins Tiger Shroff in ‘Baaghi 4’ ‘Baaghi 4’ also stars Sanjay Dutt Punjabi star Sonam Bajwa is the latest actor to join the cast of Baaghi 4, fronted by Tiger Shroff. The upcoming project is the fourth installment in the Baaghi franchise and is slated to hit the big screens on September 5, 2025. Directed by A Harsha, the film is produced by Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment. Shroff shared an Instagram Story announcing her addition to the cast.

title: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films
subtitle: In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel
author: Bhuvanesh Chandar
content: Pan-Indian cinema: A plague of tiring sequels, buzzkill cliffhangers, ineffective cameos and half-films In franchising their project for better monetisation, pan-Indian films are depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product. Big-star filmmaking is now plagued by a lack of know-how in building IPs for the long run, and the trend of splitting the story of one film into two for the sake of a sequel A two-film-strong, 340-minute-long cat-and-mouse game comes to an end in director Sukumar’s Pushpa 2: The Rule. A climactic scene ambiguously ends the arc, urging audiences to ready themselves to leave, only to be compelled back to their seats for 40 more minutes. The extended climax of the Allu Arjun-starrer, meant as a segue to a third Pushpa film, is an excruciatingly tedious episode that leaves you with a poor aftertaste — it’s a cold shower moment in this otherwise ‘wildfire’ of a film. This is a new fad picked up by commercial filmmakers of the pan-India movement — franchising, for better monetisation or to secure a working formula for the future. Most big-ticket films these days either end with a cliffhanger, depriving audiences of the satisfaction of a complete product, or add a surprise climactic cameo to end on a high note and make way for a sequel. Suriya’s Kanguvawas undoubtedly an untested attempt in Tamil, but the makers were quick to jump on this bandwagon, with a surprise cameo by Karthi and a hook to keep us waiting for the second part. With the disastrous reception at the box office, would a Kanguva sequel materialise?

title: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert
subtitle: The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘India is nobody’s property’: Diljit Dosanjh amid calls for protest against his concert The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore Amid calls for boycotting his concert, popular singer and actor Diljit Dosanjh dedicated his concert to Urdu poet Rahat Indori in Inodre, Madhya Pradesh. The Punjabi singing sensation mentioned Indori’s lines from his ghazal. “Kisi ke baap ka Hindustan thodi hai,” ( India isn’t anyone’s property) he said during the show. The singer didn’t make a direct reference to the Bajrang Dal, who protested against his concert in Indore, Madhya Pradesh. The Bajrang Dal and the Vishwa Hindu Parishad (VHP) protested against the sale of liquor and meat at singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh’s concert in Madhya Pradesh’s Indore, with some Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislators voicing their support for the demands. Hundreds of people affiliated to the Hindu outfits, carrying sticks and banners, staged a protest at the Collectorate on Sunday morning.

title: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt
subtitle: White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: Jeremy Allen White joins ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ as Rotta the Hutt White, currently filming a Bruce Springsteen biopic, rose to prominence on Showtime’s ‘Shameless’ before ‘The Bear’ propelled him to stardom with multiple awards Emmy-winning actor Jeremy Allen White is stepping into the Star Wars universe, lending his voice to Rotta the Hutt, Jabba the Hutt’s son, in the upcoming film The Mandalorian & Grogu. Known for his acclaimed role in FX’s The Bear, this marks White’s first foray into a major franchise. Set to debut on May 22, 2026, The Mandalorian & Grogu promises to expand the universe of Disney+’s hit series The Mandalorian. The show takes place after the events of Return of the Jedi, where Jabba’s death left Tatooine’s criminal underworld in chaos. While plot details remain closely guarded, White’s role as Rotta hints at new dynamics in the power struggles on the desert planet. Speculation is mounting about possible appearances from Boba Fett (Temuera Morrison) and his ally Fennec Shand (Ming-Na Wen), who previously claimed Jabba’s throne in The Book of Boba Fett.

title: ‘Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous’ trailer: Netflix’s docu offers glimpse into the life of India’s most famous rapper
subtitle: Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20
author: The Hindu Bureau
content: ‘Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous’ trailer: Netflix’s docu offers glimpse into the life of India’s most famous rapper Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20 Streaming giant Netflix on Tuesday unveiled the trailer for its upcoming documentary film, Yo Yo Honey Singh: Famous, which chronicles the journey of the titular iconic music sensation. Directed by Mozez Singh and produced by Sikhya Entertainment, the documentary premieres on Netflix on December 20. In the trailer, we see how a boy from a humble Punjabi background went on to become one of the most popular Indian rappers, taking Punjabi music to the global stage. With the help of personal accounts from friends, family, colleagues and collaborators (including one Salman Khan), the documentary peels back the layers of Honey Singh’s life to reveal the man behind the angrezi beats and controversies.

title: James Gunn to shoot ‘pickup shots’ for ‘Superman’, clarifies there are ‘no reshoots’
subtitle: ‘Superman’, starring David Corenswet in the titled role, is set for release on July 11, 2025
author: Miscellaneous
content: James Gunn to shoot ‘pickup shots’ for ‘Superman’, clarifies there are ‘no reshoots’ ‘Superman’, starring David Corenswet in the titled role, is set for release on July 11, 2025 Director and producer James Gunn has shared a clarification on the reports that his film Superman would undergo reshoots and confirmed that he will only film a few "pickup shots," according to Deadline. Taking to his social media platform, he informed his fans about the additional filming of the superhero film. "Sort of. Not a few days. We're doing a day and a half of pickup shots. No scenes. No reshoots. Just a handful of individual shots to enhance the film," Gunn shared on Threads.

title: Yash Raj Films, Posham Pa Pictures team up to produce theatrical films
subtitle: Yash Raj Films and Posham Pa Pictures will jointly produce theatrical releases starting 2025
author: Miscellaneous
content: Yash Raj Films, Posham Pa Pictures team up to produce theatrical films Yash Raj Films and Posham Pa Pictures will jointly produce theatrical releases starting 2025 Production houses Yash Raj Films (YRF) and Posham Pa Pictures on Tuesday announced a creative partnership under which they will produce theatrical films starting next year. YRF, one of the top banners of the country, has backed several diverse films including Kabhi Kabhie, Deewar, Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge, Veer-Zaara, Ek Tha Tiger, and the Dhoom franchise. Posham Pa Pictures has garnered acclaim for Kaala Paani, Mamla Legal Hai, Home Shanti and Jaadugar.

title: Akshay Kumar starts shooting for ‘Bhooth Bangla’, film to release in April 2026
subtitle: ‘Bhooth Bangla’ reunites Akshay and Priyadarshan after 14 years
author: Miscellaneous
content: Akshay Kumar starts shooting for ‘Bhooth Bangla’, film to release in April 2026 ‘Bhooth Bangla’ reunites Akshay and Priyadarshan after 14 years Bollywood superstar Akshay Kumar on Tuesday announced thatBhooth Bangla, his upcoming horror comedy with frequent collaborator Priyadarshan, will hit the theatres on April 2, 2026. The actor, who has worked with the veteran filmmaker on several hit comedies such as Hera Pheri, Garam Masala, Bhool Bhulaiyaa, and Bhagam Bhag, also said he has commenced filming on the movie.
